name: 3 Bedrooms, 2 blocks from Polanco - ALL RENOVATED!
description:
Beautifully decorated 3 bedroom apartment, it was fully renovated in April 2017. Wooden floors, marble bathrooms, sealed double glass windows (to prevent street noise) and air conditioning. 2 parking lot spaces premises. It is best suited for a maximum of 6 adults being confortable.

The space
- 24/7 doorman for security, the building also has camera. In the corner there is a Police Camera and also, the building right in front is from is a Bank Office with branch at street level, the corner of Mariano Escobedo and Mayran is busy all day long.

- I finished a full renovation of my apartment in April 2017: hardwood floors, marbel bathrooms, double glass sealed windows and air conditioning for your comfort.

-3 Bedrooms, the main room has its own bathroom and a queen bed, the other 2 rooms have a double bed and they share bathroom.

- Main room with a 50' smart TV and a desk suitable to work with a computer.

neiborhood_overview:
This area is called Nuevo Polanco, it has being gentrified recently with lots of new building, restaurant and shopping places.

In 2015 a bank inagurated a 35 story building across the street, where there is a shopping place with a Supermarket, banks, Starbucks, dry cleaning and things for daily life, and in April 2017, Mercado San Genaro, a new open-kitchen place with over 20 options to eat was opened.

Around 5-10 mins by car or twice in rush hour, you have:
Going South - Polanco, Mazarik Ave. Liverpool Deparment Store, Reforma Ave.
Going West - Antara Shopping and Plaza Carso, with nice and expensive boutiques and restaurants, Jumex Contemporary Art Museum and Soumaya Museum.

Around 15-30 minutes by car (remember, no street taxis in Mexico City, only ubers) you can go to Zona Rosa and colonias Cuauhtemoc, Juarez, Roma, Condesa, Lomas.

Remember, no street taxis in Mexico City, only ubers!

name: Walk to WTC from a Family Apartment in a Trendy Neighborhood
description:
The flat will give you the chance to live Mexico City like a local and enjoy original vintage furniture perfectly curated and revamped to meet modern needs. The 160 sq. mts. (1,722 sq. ft.) flat is a rare find in Mexico City and will ensure confort and space to enjoy your stay.

3 bedrooms (1 King, 1 Double, 1 bunkbed with 2 singles), each with fully equipped ensuite bathroom . Fully equipped kitchen, broadband internet, cable television, washer and dryer, coffee machine with complimentary capsules and fresh towels and linens. Parking available upon request at extra charge.

We are more than happy to provide any local advice and will be available 24/7, but you will have the flat all to yourself!

The apartment is in the fashionable and quiet Colonia NÃ¡poles neighborhood in Central Mexico City, a few blocks from the World Trade Center. Walk to restaurants, parks, cinemas, supermarkets, and shopping centers. Two Turibus stations are nearby.

Napole

name: Spacious apt with the best rooftop in Condesa
description:
This is a lovely apartment in Condesa. You'll love spending time on the day-beds, and having fun with Argentinian grill and wood-fired pizza oven. It features a dedicated work space and has potential to host more guests if needed for short stays. It even has a private mini patio.
We just completed renovations on the apartment and the place looks better than ever!

The space
The place is ideal for a singles or couples. Up to two children can also be accommodated but bear in mind there is only one bathroom. It has a fully equipped kitchen with a gas stove with oven, fridge, appliances and utensils. Wireless High-Speed internet, premium Cable TV package featuring HBO and Netflix. Everything is taken care off so that all you need to bring is your suit case!

Guest access
Guests will have the entire apartment to their personal use. Common areas like our beautiful roof garden and laundry room will be shared with other guests and tenants

name: Room in contemporary chic apt: Roma-Best location
description:
Room in beautiful and comfortable ground floor apartment with patio, furnished tastefully with contemporary chic design. Double height ceilings. Fully equiped. Main bedroom with ensuite bathroom. Really comfortable queen size beds. Bathtub in the main bathroom. The apartment is located in the heart of the city, the trendy La Roma district known as magical neighborhood. Walking distances to many interesting places and to Condesa district. 15 min to historic downtown by Metro or Metrobus lines.

The space
This apartment has:
- Kitchen with original design
- Nespresso, american and expresso coffee machines
- Two spacious bedrooms
- A bedroom with en-suite bathroom (for guests)
- Main bathroom with tub
- Two Full HD Led television screens with 250 channels and Netflix
- 100 Mbs Wi-Fi
- Patio to eat, smoke or relax
- Study area with interesting books

Other things to note
Cleaning service on demand. Co
host_about: I am a woman who loves knowledge, art and culture in all its manifestations, which has led me to study, travel and live in different countries. I studied film history, which I consider one of my major passions, literature, theater, painting, drawing, philosophy and art history. Besides this I enjoy very much to attend concerts of classical music and opera regularly. Also exhibitions of art and photography. I like to meet people and share life with them. I appreciate true friendship and family. I love life, with all that it implies. I'm interested in meeting people who understand life as a journey of learning, wisdom and pleasure.

neiborhood_overview: La Roma district is an old and elegant neighbourhood, very trendy,  full of cafes, galleries, bars  and restaurants. It has been selected as the coolest neighbourhood in MÃ©xico City in 2018. Young artists have arrived recently to the area where famous people have lived. The surrealist Leonora Carrington, Fidel Castro, Jack Kerouac, Kati Horna, JosÃ© Emilio Pacheco, William S. Burroughs and Carlos Fuentes to mention some. I really love the history of this area. Many books and novels have been written about it. Actually, even when I have lived here for years, it surprises me very often because it is full of magic and mystery. A really enjoyable place. Have a look to my guide for interesting places to visit.

name: Beautiful designer artists home..
description:
Exquisite house in quiet safe area. Long term also. Neighbors to Frida & Trotsky; restaurants, bars in walking distance. 5 mins walk to the main square & Cineteca, Apartment with private patio & shared roof garden. Great light: Magical Space! We are offering it during November at 40% of normal price - if the dates work its a brilliant deal!~

The space
I travel regularly and would love to rent out my home. It has three bedrooms all with their own en suite bathrooms large living room complete with pool table... open plan and kitchen internet, TV, parking for one car.. the house backs on to Frida's Casa Azul... in beautiful Coyoacan. I am an artist / film maker and the house is filled with art and has great personality... The rent includes the payment for Teo who lives just off the premises who cleans the house and changes sheets etc. Will baby sit for additional fee. For more information and additional photos contact me. Coyoacan is safe and quiet ideal for a
host_about: I am a mother, documentary film maker and photo curator, originally from England but today live in  Mexico City. I love design, art, photography (movies of course) meeting new people and hosting the apartments. Coyoacan is an amazing neighborhood and it gives me pleasure in introducing our guests to places I have discovered over time. We love sharing with our visitors at the same time respecting their total privacy, I have been a super host now for over 5 years... and take pride in taking care of our guests. It matters! I have had some not so good experiences traveling myself and so all the more reason to make the stay for our visitors the best possible.

name: Cuarto Amplio con Estudio, Roma DF.
description:
The Mexican Roma is the place to be, this is an original house of the time.

The space
Private room and studio with good natural lightning from windows facing the street, a double size mattress and a desk. Maximum accommodation is for two people, in the comfortable bed and/or in your studio which has a futon too! The closet has enough space for both.

Guest access
There is a nice terrace on the rooftop where you can have your coffee or tea in the morning and/or also a beer later with an amazing weather and incredible plants surrounding the space.

Other things to note
It is a quiet neighborhood in an enourmos city, with a great vibe just two blocks away from trendy Orizaba avenue in the main Roma. There is an accessible laundry place right in front of the house, coffee, restaurants and bars.
host_about: traveler, artist and industrial designer. I spend most of the day painting or building things in my studio, i play fÃºtbol and enjoy having coffee or beer on the rooftop every now and then. Iâm easy going and respectful, which is what i expect from others as well.

name: Room & bathroom in great house!
description:
We are offering special summer discount in our places - this year celebrating our 5th year when enquiring just ask! Beautiful space, quiet safe great neighborhood! Museums, restaurants, bars in walking distance.

The space
LIGHT, SPACIOUS, QUIET, FRIENDLY LOCATION.
ARRIVE IN MEXICO CITY AND STAY IN A GREAT HOUSE, PERFECT FOR A SHORT STAY FOR ONE OR TWO PEOPLE. THIS BEDROOM HAS A FLAT BED SCREEN AND DVD PLAYER, RELIABLE FAST WIRELESS INTERNET LAUNDRY ON THE PREMISES, CLEANING and BED AND TOWEL CHANGE EVERY 3 DAYS. THE KITCHEN IS AVAILABLE FOR MAKING COFFEE, AND WE LEAVE PAN DULCE FOR OUR GUESTS. WILL SHOW YOU WHERE THINGS ARE KEPT. MORE DIY THAN B&B! THE PROPERTY BACKS ON TO THE CASA AZUL, FRIDA KAHLO'S HOUSE IN COYOACAN. SITUATED ON A QUIET SAFE STREET. TEN MINUTES WALK TO THE SUBWAY. AROUND THE CORNER IS THE FAMOUS COYOACAN MARKET AND SQUARE WITH ARTISAN STORES, WITH RESTAURANTS, BARS AND CAFE'S . THIS IS A BEAUTIFUL SAFE AND QUIET NEIGHORHOOD. AN ID
host_about: I am a mother, documentary film maker and photo curator, originally from England but today live in  Mexico City. I love design, art, photography (movies of course) meeting new people and hosting the apartments. Coyoacan is an amazing neighborhood and it gives me pleasure in introducing our guests to places I have discovered over time. We love sharing with our visitors at the same time respecting their total privacy, I have been a super host now for over 5 years... and take pride in taking care of our guests. It matters! I have had some not so good experiences traveling myself and so all the more reason to make the stay for our visitors the best possible.

name: Cool apartment with  the Best Roof Top in Condesa
description:
This is a lovely one bedroom - one bathroom apartment with a super comfortable king size bed, a very fresh take on retro style and an awesome rooftop. You'll love spending time on the day-beds, and having fun with Argentinian grill and wood-fired pizza oven.

The space
The place is ideal for singles or couples. A third person can stay at the sofa in the living room but this only recommended for 1 or two days. It has a fully equipped kitchen with a gas stove with oven, fridge, appliances and utensils. It also includes fresh linens and towels, Wireless High-Speed internet, premium Cable TV that has channels like HBO. Everything is taken care off so that all you need to bring is your suit case!
The apartment is located just a few steps above ground level so it is very easy to access.
It has 3 main windows and a fourth one for ventilation in the bathroom all of which face the inner side of the building.

name: Best Views in the heart of Condesa
description:
This is a unique apartment located on the top floor of a 1959 apartment building of La Condesa neighborhood.
In 1957 we had one of the biggest earthquakes in the city. This building was very well design on structure by a Civic Engineer and has perfectly survived all major earthquakes in our shaky City.
In 2002, we did a major remodeling of the building. The Rasta Apartment has been designed with recycled materials and lots details in each space. It has a lot of light and visual finials to huge Jacaranda trees (Mexican cherry blossom by Matsumoto) and the City.
There might be City Noise.

2 bedrooms with their own natural ventilated bathroom. Extra toilette for guests.
3 roof gardens:
1st with thermal volcanic tile 20m2 (215SqF)
2nd with wood deck and lots of endemic plants 20m2 (215SqF)
3rd with natural grass 9m2 (96SqF)

1 King size bed
1 full size Futon bed
Linens
Towels
Blankets
Tableware
Silverw

name: Cosy apartment in Polanco near park
description:
In the heart of Polanco, the european vibrant neighbourhood of Mexico, 1 block away from the park, spacious 2 bedroom with balcony surrounded by the most trendy restaurants in town like Mythos, Loggia & Tori Tori. Easy access to get out of Polanco.

The space
Beautifully furbished, in a french style decoration. 2 bedrooms, 1,5 bathrooms, spacious living room with TV and balcony, piano and dining room, fully equipped kitchen on one of the most exclusive and safe street of Mexico City. Located in the heart of Polanco district, 1 block away from the main parc and surrounded by the best and most fashionable restaurants in town, including : best japonese restaurant, best breakfast, best shopping area (1 block away from Presidente Masaryk, the equivalent of 5th Ave). 2 blocks away from the main city arteria Reforma and 5 min walk from supermarket. The apartment is in a 3 storie building, neighbors are nice, young executives and some families. 24h security, alarm system
host_about: I am french and live in Mexico City since 2004. I love cooking and receiving friends for dinner and play the piano.

neiborhood_overview:
So many great places around starting with all the best restaurants are less than 2 blocks away: Cipriani, Tori Tori, Mythos, Comensal, Buena Barra.
Salon to do your hair and nails in front of the building door as well as the Best breakast in town "Maison Belen". The Lincoln park is 1.5 block away and Ghandi Park (for runners) is 5 minutes away. Also Anthropology museum as well as Auditorio Nacional (for concerts) are both less than 10min away walking.

name: Cozy suite-style apartment for single travelers
description:
Villa Mural is a centric urban space conformed by charming outdoor spaces and 6 comfortable accommodations; 5 one-bedroom apartments & 1 studio, which are available for one-month-minimum stays, for travelers who seek a place to stay at during their work / study trip to Mexico City.

The space
Our property represents a destination by itself. This cozy one-bedroom apartment is one of the 6 units that conform Villa Mural, a magnificent urban villa located within what is known to be the "geographical center" of Mexico City. It is currently the most original lodging concept in town.

Upon staying at this comfortable accommodation, you will be able to enjoy a peaceful and private space within an environment where you will also be able to meet other travelers from around the world and exchange with them valuable impressions and recommendations. Moreover, you will live the experience like a local of this fascinating metropolis, enjoying both your own private spa
host_about:
If you're anything like us, then you most likely love to travel around the world, savoring the most extraordinary foods and wines and encountering all the amazing spots a new place has to offer out-of-towners.

Without a doubt, you also enjoy getting to feel the essence of a vernacular culture while staying at high-end, luxurious, centrally located, comfortable retreats. But most importantly, I bet you really prefer doing so without having to pay the price tag for all you are receiving and that's what we call being a "Smart Travel Decision Maker".

Well, we have some very good news for you today, since our splendid "Non-Smoking Residencies and Studios" located at the heart of MexicoÂ´s capital, are all about that and had been recently made accessible to savvy travelers like you. 

Hi there! We are Jorge & Monnah and we really like to make new friends, especially people from outside Mexico.  We've been traveling around the world for quite some time now. We are a family of 4 currently living in breath-taking CancÃºn, MEXICO. We have this marvelous properties in Mexico City that we really love for its history in our family and every time we go to our Big City, we enjoy enormously staying at any of them. We love and enjoy MÃ©xico City like few other places in the whole world. These unique accommodations are available now with all sort of amenities and services to assure a comfortable stay to our important guests. We are very accommodating hosts so if any of our guests needs anything, we are always willing to help; so please don't hesitate to ask...

We're sure that you and your travel companions will also enjoy your next trip to Mexico the way you never anticipated, should you resolve to come over and stay at any of our gorgeous properties. So we encourage you to make yourself your own "Smart Travel Decision" and enjoy your upcoming adventure in wonderful MÃ©xico City like you never thought possible by making our home your home. 

Mi casa es su casa!

Sincerely, 

Jorge & Monnah

neiborhood_overview:
The Escandon neighborhood was founded in the early 19th century and was part of the Hacienda de la Condesa, and it is divided into 2 sections: Escandon I & Escandon II. Villa Mural pertains to the first. We are located within what is known to be "the geographical center of the metropolitan area" which gives our guests a chance to move faster and more easily in any direction.

In our immediate area, there are all kinds of businesses within a 5 block radius: several convenience stores or as we call them "corner shops"; the Escandon local market with all kinds of fresh produce; restaurants, coffee shops & bakeries; pharmacy stores; banks with ATM machines; barber shops; and even a fire department, a police department and a church just around the corner. The Escandon is, in short, a centric and accessible neighborhood, with all kinds of services at your fingertips.

You can also walk to the Metropoli Patriotismo shopping mall, located a bit over one kilometer away, and

name: Beguest Reforma | King SZ | Gym | American Embassy
description:
Experience the best of Mexico City in this executive suite located in the Juarez neighborhood. The apartment is part of "Magenta" building which has many amenities including a heated indoor pool, fully equipped gym & garden. Just in front of American Embassy & Above Marriot hotel, has the best location to get Colonia Roma, Condesa & Polanco. Perfect spot to work from the comfort of home with 50 mbps WiFi. When you stay with Beguest for more than 7 nights we also offer one free cleaning per week.

The space
This 860 sq. foot (80 sq. meters) design apartment has comfortable and huge king size bed. The high ceiling apartment has a fully equipped open style kitchen with a stove, oven, refrigerator, washer and dryer. The kitchen opens up into a living room which has a sofa bed and 43-inch smart TV, apple TV, (Netflix included) There is also a modern bathroom with a glass shower.

name: MODERN/HIP FURNISHED APARTMENT ( S1 Condesa Haus)
description:
This is a one bedroom furnished apartment in the heart of the Condesa Neighborhood.

All you need is to relax, and let us take care of you. The apartment has Wi fi Internet, Flat Cable TV , a fully equipped Kitchen w/utensils, living, a 4 seat dinning table and a small balcony . There is also a washer and dryer available. IF there are 3 guests we can add a twin bed in the living area,

Services included. Wi fi internet, Cable TV and daily house keeping 3 times a week for long stays .

The space
You can also have access to a very nice ROOF TOP where you can chill out, relax, read or work.

We are located in the heart of Condesa, one block walking from all the cafes, restaurants and cool bars and nightclubs of Condesa

We can also help you getting around in the City , for more than 10 years we have been helping our guest to make the best out of their trip in Mexico City.
host_about: Condesa Haus  is Bed & Breakfast located on the heart of Condesa,  all our rooms are private and private bathroom, We offer a nice full breakfast every morning  and a reception service to help you make your stay more comfortable so yo can enjoy the beauty of Mexico City !

name: A small independent space
description:
The space (one big room, a small kitchen and bathroom) is located on the roof top of my house in a small street with a cozy equipped kitchen, bathroom and terrace. It is perfect for 2 people. The location is very central in front of Chapultepec park and one street from trendy Condesa.

The space
The apartment is a private space independent from the rest of the house, but within the safety of my home. The access is through the garage. It has a little equipped kitchen, so you can prepare your meals there if you want to. It has one bathroom. Enjoy the roof garden. The location is very centric, the park is just across the street and trendy Condesa a 5 minute walk away. You get to any point of the City easily.

Guest access
If you stay a little longer, cleaning service is available upon request and a fee.

Other things to note
The house is located in one of the biggest cities, you will have some noise- On its backside there i

The cultural part is a 10 minute walk away starting with the most important museums on Reforma and Polanco, where you can find an infinite number of bars and restaurants and shopping opportunities. You will stay at a small site in the middle of boiling Mexico-City, getting quickly to sites of interest!

name: Bright, quiet, clean, centric, garden view
description:
Come home to a beautiful sunny room in a classic house in the financial heart of Mexico City. Blocks away from the WTC, restaurants, museums and Metrobus. Great neighborhood. Food market on Sundays. In the best part of the city! Cats and children in the house. May be noisy in the mornings. Matress is very firm, some people may not like it. Do not book if you can't follow rules or haven't read the whole ad.

The space
Come live in a classic HOUSE in the Napoles district, one of the most exclusive in the city. 2.5 bathrooms are shared between all 6 guests. Great for students, couples and professionals. The place is well maintained and right in the middle of it all! It's located in a quiet street too. You can see the WTC Mexico building from your window. You have access to the back garden, tables and chairs available to facilitate distancing. There's a flea market on Sundays that sells delicious food and every product you can think of, Nearby, on weekdays, there are
host_about: A Mexico City native. Lived in the bay area for several years. Into bicycles, film, jazz, good music, good coffee and good people.

neiborhood_overview:
The food, The people, The Views, and More:

Good gastronomic selection.

You can pick up pizza on your way here from the metrobus station, have tacos, tortas, pizzas, or go to the flea market on Sundays and buy fresh meat, fruit, or movies.

Clean, and safe area, full of trees, beautiful classic houses, a pretty park (Alabama and New York) and modern buildings. There's a nice view everywhere you turn.

Nice, friendly, and warm people. You will find top notch businesses here, superama, movie theaters, computer stores. There is always something to do, someone to meet, somewhere to go.

The iconic Polyforum Siqueiros, which contains the largest mural ever made is a 5 minute walk from the house. The WTC (formerly known as the Mexico Hotel) is right next to that. You can shop at supermarkets, or flea/farmers markets (where you can find incredibly fresh food, sun-glasses, ipod chargers, you name it). There are shopping malls, movie theaters,

description:
Family house. One of the last big houses of La Napoles.

Excellent location.

Two cats live in the house.

No smoking.

There is no arrival time. We only ask for discretion when entering at night. Quiet time 10 pm to 6 am.

Must wear mask in common areas.

Must be a functional responsible adult and be able to folllow rules.

The space
Bright and cozy room with a full size bed, a balcony in a classic shared house in the Napoles district, one of the most exclusive in the city. 1.5 shared bathrooms. The place is well kept and right in the middle of it all! It's located in a quiet street too.

One of the last great houses of La Napoles. A few blocks from the WTC and the "poliforum" station of the metrobus. Excellent location, surrounded by restaurants, near Superma Dakota, market on wheels on Sundays, Cinemex in the wtc, parks, shopping malls.

HOW IS THE ROMA NORTE TOWN?
The Roma Norte town has beautiful homes and streets with beautiful trees; the town has a bohemian style, a lot of different kind of cafeterias, restaurants and bars to make you enjoy the Mexico City lifestyle. It has an excellent location, near a main of touristic places in the city and easy way to move an others touristic areas.

"Casa de Mi Morenita" is in the heart of the city inside in a top of the city town Roma-Condesa area where has a lot of activities, which has been called by the National Arts Institute of Mexico INBA as " Artistic Monuments Zone "which in recent years is being in revitalization of public spaces, historic buildings which have activities like a contemporary art, fashion, movies, entertainment, restaurants, bars, galleries etc. Or only you can enjoy the sunset while you walk in around the town.

WHATÂ´S AROUND THE TOWN?
Casa Lamm Cultural Center (3 blocks)
Rio de Janeiro Park (2 blocks)
UNAM U

Great and unique restored apartment in historic 1940s building in the heart of Polanco. A block away from mayor hotels, a block from Lincoln Park, walking to Anthropology Museum and Chapultepec.

Best area to stay for all travel purposes!!

The space
Unique space in a beautiful historic building.

Two separate private and cozy rooms with queen size beds. One bathroom, open kitchen ready to cook and living room with Cable TV.

Real hardwood floor and chimney.

Washing & dryer machines

Guest access
You'll be renting the whole apartment :)

Additional cleaning service upon request.

Other things to note
All the neighbors are very friendly, welcoming and helpful!!

The apartment is on a third floor and there is no elevator in the building.

I also own a dog boarding business 15 minutes away from San Miguel de Allende :)

host_about:
Easy going. respectful, friendly, reliable.
My first experience with Airbnb was in August 2014, as a guest, traveling to Chicago USA.
The experience was very good, so in September 2014 decided to join as a host, offering a couple of options and prices to stay in Mexico City.

I like that the guests enjoy their stay and their space, in total privacy.
My priority is to offer nice, clean, safe and well located place; at a  affordable rate.

I have always lived in Mexico City, I know it very well. It will be a pleasure to guide you and help you with any questions, suggestions that you require, or need that you have.
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Sencillo. respetuoso, amigable, confiable.
Mi primera experiencia en Airbnb fue en Agosto 2014, como huÃ©sped, viajando a Chicago USA. 
La experiencia fue muy buena, por lo que en Septiembre 2014 decidÃ­ incorporarme como  anfitriÃ³n, ofreciendo un par de opciones y precios, para alojarse en la ciudad de MÃ©xico.

description:
Located in Colonia Roma, a classic district of the city turned into one of the most trendy areas to visit in Mexico City.

Surrounded by local life, parks, markets, local shops, restaurants, street food, night spots, short distance to other tourist spots, neighbor trendy districts and close enough from city downtown.

Nice and peaceful, co-living, co-working, traveling, networking environment.

As a 15 year tourist/service experienced host I will be a very helpful and safe host during your stay.

The space
In the house/apartment (tricky to explain, youâll get it when you get here) there are three bedrooms:
My bedroom and two private guest rooms (for up to two guests) available for rent in different listings.
Contact me if you would like/need to rent both or more (read forward).

You would occupy one of the guest bedrooms while the other is usually hosting another guest(s). Both rooms offer and are equipped with pre
host_about:
Eager to host  and meet new people like you everyday and give my best advice about your adventure in Mexico City.
I lived working in the service/tourism business for 5 years in Playa del Carmen Mexico, a tourism industry focused city in the Mexican Caribbean, where I learnt the tourism business and met many travelers like myself and you.
From my experience working in the tourism industry and as a traveler as well I know first hand how helpful a good tip can be in regards to where to go, places of interest, where to eat, how to get around and the importance of knowing where to go in case of a health emergency and how to stay safe. 

I currently live in Mexico City, work has brought me back to the city where I am from.
As a local and having been around for nearly 40 years I know the city extremely well. If you need any tips on where to eat, where to go, how to get around, and maybe more important WHERE NOT TO, WHEN NOT TO, and HOW NOT TO make sure to ask. I want my guests to have a great time in my place, my city and my country.

Traveling and meeting new people is my passion. I have been to many places (not enough yet) and met loads of amazing people along the way. Been in the tourism/service business for nearly 15 years, in direct contact with foreigners and expats for nearly 25, so I can communicate and advise about pretty much anything with particular great expertise. I will be a very helpful and safe host during your stay.
Unless Iâm out of town or in exceptional circumstances, very few times I donât meet my guests. I've hosted around a thousand guests from all over Mexico and the world, with a thousand different stories. I will always be interested to hear yours, happy and eager to meet travelers like you and will try to make your stay at my place as pleasant as possible.

name: Cute apartment by WTC
description:
It is a suite-type apartment, equipped with all you need to make your stay pleasant and welcoming. Ideal for couples and people traveling for business or tourism. The apartment is within one of the most beautiful and best located areas of Mexico City, in the heart of Napoles neighborhood. It is only two blocks away from the WTC and the Pepsi Center.

The space
It is a lovely suite with an equipped kitchen. The bathroom has a whirlpool tub, TV with Netflix and Amazon Prime TV, it has no cable or open TV. Memory foam mattress of the best quality. It is newly remodeled.

Other things to note
The apartment is on the fourth floor, the building has no elevator but the view compensate this. The building is monitored by closed circuit cameras, and also we have a maintenance person 24 hours a day.

name: Unique Room in the Centric Polanco District
description:
Amazing room! Luminous and with a view of a fabulous Hule tree, the tree of abundance. Your queen size bed is warmed with 400 count Egiptian cotton sheets and a snuggling quilt. Enjoy your own closet and PRIVATE bathroom with a big shower. Prep your meeting or trip on your desk viewing the Hule tree. The space is fully equipped to meet your every need with adequate INTERNET!
Location superb! If you love morning runs, you can enjoy them at Parque Lincoln or Bosque de Chapultepec. The apartment is walking distance to many offices, museums, shops and the best restaurants in town. Tucked away enough to avoid the crowds, the apartment is warmly decorated, trendy and fantastically distributed.
Read a book in the cozy living room, or cook in our kitchen. You are welcome to use all our kitchen utensils and supplies! Try our coffee and tea in the morning! And enjoy starting your day with fresh fruit!

Apartment
1 bed
Common Areas
Kitchen
Wi fi Interne
host_about:
I am from Mexico City, a Freelance Film Producer, Writer and Chef! 
Movies,  writing, cooking, and travel adventures are on my top list. 
I believe laughter and sharing stories with people from all over the globe, are essential, the greatest medicine of our time. I think it is essential to meet people from all over and share cultures and stories!
I love my Mexico and hope you get a glimpse of it through my lovely home.

host_about:
Easy going. respectful, friendly, reliable.
My first experience with Airbnb was in August 2014, as a guest, traveling to Chicago USA.
The experience was very good, so in September 2014 decided to join as a host, offering a couple of options and prices to stay in Mexico City.

I like that the guests enjoy their stay and their space, in total privacy.
My priority is to offer nice, clean, safe and well located place; at a  affordable rate.

I have always lived in Mexico City, I know it very well. It will be a pleasure to guide you and help you with any questions, suggestions that you require, or need that you have.
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Sencillo. respetuoso, amigable, confiable.
Mi primera experiencia en Airbnb fue en Agosto 2014, como huÃ©sped, viajando a Chicago USA. 
La experiencia fue muy buena, por lo que en Septiembre 2014 decidÃ­ incorporarme como  anfitriÃ³n, ofreciendo un par de opciones y precios, para alojarse en la ciudad de MÃ©xico. 

Me agrada que el huÃ©sped disfrute su estancia y su espacio, en total privacidad.
Mi prioridad es ofrecer un lugar agradable, limpio, seguro y bien ubicado; a una tarifa accesible.

Siempre he vivido en la ciudad de MÃ©xico, la conozco muy bien. SerÃ¡ un placer orientarte, sugerirte y ayudarte en lo que necesites...  si asÃ­ lo deseas.

neiborhood_overview:
Conveniently located in a residential and very safe Ã¡rea of the city.
You can walk in the area day and night (24 hrs).
Well connected to get by subway to the main attractions of the City.

Main Subway Line 3: One block (2 minutes walk).
Line 3 is the main Line of Mexico City subway, connects to all subway Lines, main neighborhoods, and tourist attractions of the city.

Beside the Loft you have a cafeteria, a 7 Eleven (24 hrs), a laundry a dry cleaner shops, 2 restaurants. And around the Loft, at distances of 1 to 2 blocks, you have bike rental, a gym, a park where you can do yoga, joging, running, etc; There are 2 shopping centers, cinemas, restaurants, cafes, banks, pharmacy 24 hours, supermarkets, convenience stores, Pizza Hut, 2 Starbucks Cafe, etc etc. All at distances of 1 to maximum 5 minute walk.

name: CDMX âPH1â in La Condesa
description:
This is a beautiful Penthouse in the trendiest part of Mexico City, La Condesa. It has a large private balcony, 24/7 security, doorman, parking, furnished roof-deck, elevator & much more.

The space
Nestled in the heart of trendy La Condesa, this modern lofted penthouse is the number one vacation rental in Mexico City. Designed by world renowned architect Michel Rojkind, the building itself is an architectural gem, filled with suspended glass walkways and twinkling lights. Inside PH1, you will find sleek industrial designs,Â two story ceilings, large airy living spaces, sun filled rooms and fantastic views of the neighborhood. A modern kitchen imported from Italy, two sunlit balconies, lofted workspace and beautiful Mexican artwork are just some of the many highlights of this prize winning loft.


(The Penthouse is approx. 2,000 sq. feet - 180 sq. meter)

The apartment is just blocks away from the beautiful park, Parque Mexico, which is at

neiborhood_overview:
This is by far the best location in Mexico City. right in the heart of the vast city, you are never too far from anything.

It is a very relaxed environment, one of the safest parts of Mexico. And about 20 minutes away from the airport.

Foreign influence is evident on the architecture in this neighborhood. beautiful colonial designs and art-deco styles. Truly a relic from another era.

The highlights of this neighborhood include:

A vast variety of restaurants/coffee shops
Boutique shops
Lots of green space/parks
Delicious street food
Adept street artists
Vivid nightlife

The space
This is a classic house in the Napoles district, one of the most exclusive in the city. Full size bed, great for couples. Great for students and professionals. You can see the WTC Mexico building from the back garden! there's a food market on Sundays that sells delicious food and every product you can think of, Nearby, on weekdays, there are local business for your every need.

On site washing machine is $30 pesos per

Good gastronomic selection.

You can pick up pizza on your way here from the metrobus station, have tacos, tortas, coffee, or go to the flea market on Sundays and buy fresh meat, fruit, or movies.

host_about:
Easy going. respectful, friendly, reliable.
My first experience with Airbnb was in August 2014, as a guest, traveling to Chicago USA.
The experience was very good, so in September 2014 decided to join as a host, offering a couple of options and prices to stay in Mexico City.

I like that the guests enjoy their stay and their space, in total privacy.
My priority is to offer nice, clean, safe and well located place; at a  affordable rate.

I have always lived in Mexico City, I know it very well. It will be a pleasure to guide you and help you with any questions, suggestions that you require, or need that you have.
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Sencillo. respetuoso, amigable, confiable.
Mi primera experiencia en Airbnb fue en Agosto 2014, como huÃ©sped, viajando a Chicago USA. 
La experiencia fue muy buena, por lo que en Septiembre 2014 decidÃ­ incorporarme como  anfitriÃ³n, ofreciendo un par de opciones y precios, para alojarse en la ciudad de MÃ©xico. 

Me agrada que el huÃ©sped disfrute su estancia y su espacio, en total privacidad.
Mi prioridad es ofrecer un lugar agradable, limpio, seguro y bien ubicado; a una tarifa accesible.

Siempre he vivido en la ciudad de MÃ©xico, la conozco muy bien. SerÃ¡ un placer orientarte, sugerirte y ayudarte en lo que necesites...  si asÃ­ lo deseas.

name: Sunny spacious apartment in the heart of Condesa
description:
Very spacious, light-filled apartment at the heart of Condesa.
Views towards Amsterdam avenue from the living room, dinning room and open kitchen. Steps away from Parque Mexico surrounded by charming restaurants and shops.

The space
Bright and beautiful apartment in second floor of a building facing Amsterdam street, located in the heart of the Condesa Neighborhood.
Natural wooden floors, plenty of natural sunlight, open kitchen with granite counters, large living room and dinning space, studio, 1 bedroom and 1 bathroom.
Plenty of cafes , restaurants, galleries and beautiful little shops around.


Transportation:
The nearest subway station is just 5 blocks away, and my apartment is between two important arteries the Nuevo Leon Street and Insurgentes sur Avenue. You can move to other parts of the city with ease.

Important note: I usually require 3-4 days of notice before you arrive since I have to make several prepar

name: Stardom spot in Roma Norte.
description:
A modern contemporary arquitecture full apartment, in the best location for visiting MÃ©xico City. Just a few steps away from the main art galleries, museums, restaurants, and designer stores in the heyday cultural and gastronomic scene of the city.

The space
A 100m2 apartment, with modern arquitecture, high ceilings, wood finishes and exposed concrete walls.
The main bedroom has a king sized bed and an independant bathroom.
The 2nd bedroom has a double bed and it shares the guests bathroom.

Both bedrooms have empty closets so you can use them for your clothes, luggage and shopping bags.

The kitchen is open, it has a marble bar with two benches, and itâs equipped with a large fridge, stove and cookware.

The apartment also has a washer dryer.

The dining table is for 4-6 persons. The living room has tv with basic cable, Apple TV and 30mbps high speed internet.

A nice balcony with an appealing view

description:
One of the best locations you will find in Mexico City!

Close to downtown, fashionable La Condesa & La Roma, Polanco and Zona Rosa.

Perfect place to rest, just in the middle of bustling and exciting Mexico City, in one of the safest areas.

The space
Welcome to your home in Mexico City!

Beautiful loft in one of the best locations you will find in Mexico City!. Close to downtown, fashionable La Condesa & La Roma, Polanco and Zona Rosa.

You'll find everything you need for a comfortable stay; on the upper level there are 2 rooms, a Master Bedroom with a queen size bed, and a Double Bedroom with 2 twin beds and a walk-in closet. You will also find on the upper level the main bathroom with a generous size walk-in shower and a large sink with plenty of space for your toilet tiers

All linen is 100% high quality cotton.

On the lower level, there is an open-plan living and dining area. Kitchen is equipped w

I work for a multinational company in Mexico City, and I've lived, worked and studied in Florence, Madrid and Paris.

My passion is to travel and I do believe that "the world is a great book of which they who never stir from home read only one page" (Augustine).

name: Great Location! Entire Apartment!!
description:
Casita La Roma is a Truly Unique place to stay, An entire apartment perfect for 2 people plus a sofa bed for 1 more (at the livingroom), 2 blocks away from public transportation.
La Roma Sur is a very famous neighborhood full of restaurants, coffee shops, street food, and more. Very Hip!!
You can easily walk to La Condesa neighborhood, with plenty of Great Restaurants and Night Life. Very safe building
You're going to love the area, it is such a cool place to stay and explore Mexico City!.

The space
Casita La Roma is truly unique and cozy apartment, it seems like a little house, vibrant colors every where, full of details, perfect for one or two people (there is an extra space for 1 more in a sofa bed additional charge apply)
You're going to love the building is very peculiar and colonial architecture style, it is one floor building which is perfect and very secure!! We have TV and Cable!!!!
One bedroom with a closet with lots of

Diana, Maria and David.

name: Lighted room with private bathroom
description:
We are a young French/Mexican couple who work in the film industry. When we can't travel, we loved to meet people from different horizons (close or far).
San Pedro de los Pinos, a quiet and traditional neighborhood, is near to Condesa (5 min by taxi).
Metro station is two blocks away.
We have two loving dogs (a whippet and a street dog - German shepherd-ish).
Lightly room full of DVD (and big screen) if watching movie is you thing. You have your own bathroom.

The space
Very clean place (free cleaning three time a week).
Free breakfast.
200 MB internet
You can rent the whole flat if you want to.

Guest access
You can relax in the living room and eat/cook in our well supplied kitchen. We also have a little studio which is perfect if you are looking for a quiet place to work in.

Other things to note
We are located very near Revolution avenue: can be noisy sometimes.

name: Beautiful cottage in country side ranch near CDMX.
description:
Relax in this unique and peaceful getaway. Enjoy nature and the company of family and friends in a country side atmosphere.

Events with more than 8 people* must be arranged with the host and will have a different rate. We offer the option of banquet service (taquiza, barbecue, paella, buffet, sandwiches) and furniture for family events with up to 150 people** Pulse Gourmet ** visit our page on IG

* maximum 8 people can sleep in the property.

Guest access
The area where the animals are located may be accessed with the supervision of the caretaker for the safety of the guests.

In case of events, the harmony of the place and the tranquility of the neighbors in relation to the noise level must be preserved.

Other things to note
There is a horse, a pig and 3 noble dogs that live with people and other dogs that live with other dogs.

name: Polanco - Accesible and quiet
description:
Unbeatable location. Low risk seismic area. Lower floor easy to evacuate in an emergency. Perfect for business trips. Comfortable, clean and recently remodeled. Up to 4 people (at least 2 would have to share bed). Parking space for 1 small or medium size car (no SUVs, mini vans). 5 min walk from Polanco subway station. Museums, shopping centers, theaters, movies, and superb restaurants right in the area. Mexican fiscal invoice available upon request. Building verified for post-earthquake safetly

The space
Quiet and comfortable. Bathroom and flooring remodeled recently. Fully equipped kitchen with Nespresso coffee machine and 10 complimentary capsules when you arrive. Microwave, fridge, washing machine and dryer, toaster, blender. One double bed, plus a queen size super comfortable futon (in the 2nd room). Small individual sofa bed for one (rather for children or small persons) in the living room). WiFi internet, flat screen TV, doorman and parking for one smal
host_about: World traveler, global philanthropy consultant.  Love to go around feeling always at home.

name: A really spacious room at La Roma!
description:
A big room at La Roma Sur with its own bathroom, refrige, security box & big smart TV and its own Internet node.
Few blocks from Amsterdam (La condesa), Chilpancingo metro station and 15 minutes walking distance from La Roma Norte, next to Eco Bici station. You do not have to worry about transportation at all!

The space
Big room with its own dinner table and its italian chairs, its own security box and refrigerator (because our guests are the most important) and very big smart TV And a security lock.
The kitchen, the dinning room and living room is shared with other Guest. It has its own Internet node.
The apartment is at the first floor so if you buy errands or have to carry thing you do not have to go up the stairs.
You do not believe how Beautiful is the building inside, it is an old building built during the Mexico Art Deco Porfiriato.
The best plus is your privacy!!

One day cleaning service included!!!!!

Gue

name: Place in Condesa in the Chilaquil corner
description:
The apartment is situated on a quiet street in the heart of Condesa. It includes a huge living room, dining room, kitchen, a bathroom and an available bedroom. The apartment size is 100 sqm.

Condesa is the safest, hipster and vibrant area in CDMX. We try to keep the apartment bright with a unique soul with vintage deco. Move around by foot and explore the unique bars and restaurants that enchant the neighbourhood.

The space
The apartment is located in one of the most beautiful areas in Ciudad de Mexico, so you will feel fascinated and comfortable due to the characteristics and accessibility of the neighborhood.

The apartment and Condesa area have a vintage and hipster decoration, the buildings are more than 50 years old but you will feel a charming sensation.

Guest access
There is one available room, a futon, a couch and an air bed available. The apartment has no parking lot, but there is a parking lot where you can p
host_about: Mexican passionate about travel & sharing economy. Entrepreneur looking for a way around the world. Guest and host since 2014. Grateful meeting new people in different parts of the world and learning from different cultures. Airbnb describes my faith in humanity =)

neiborhood_overview: The Condesa neighborhood is the hipster area of Mexico city. It has become a perfect walkable area. It has everything that you may need. Fancy Bars, Mezcal shops, night clubs, all kinds of restaurants of all prices and all foods. Supermarkets, convenience, and also department stores. Banks, galleries, yoga studios, cinemas, etc. Everything at walking distance. It really is a very enjoyable area. Additionally, there are two big parks where people walk their pets or go out running. The Chapultepec park is 15 min by walking. It has some great museums and it is perfect for jogging.

name: A Urban Oasis in Coyoacan-Frida Msm
description:
As some guests called it :)... Is a urban oasis or a Sanctuary in a big bustling city!
A beautiful modern 2BD and 2Bathroom apartment that comfortably fits 4-7, is centrally located on a quiet street, just 4 blocks from Frida Museum and Coyoacan.
Enjoy the kitchen, pool and gym.

The space
Upon arrival, you will find a beautiful, clean, quiet, very safe; restful spacious, naturally illuminated apartment. A cozy full size beds provides a wonderful night of sleep.
Cozy two bedrooms with High Speed Wi-fi.
The principal room has a bathroom inside and the second room have also a bathroom but outside the room.
Guest can do laundry in the washer and dryer, make use of the swimming pool and the gym of the building.
The street and the neighborhood is really calm and safe, also convenient because it is only one block away from a Main Street where you can find public transportation.
The apartment is one block away form the Cineteca Naci
host_about:
Hola! By the moment I'm working and living in QuerÃ©taro so I have the apartment free to host visitors from all over the world. I hope that you enjoy your stay as much as I do when I am in Mexico City.
About 2 years ago the rules of the building changed and I wasn't allowed to host anymore so I had to cancel my reservations. I'm super sorry about that! Now everything is clear and won't happened again so please don't be afraid. 

I really enjoy travelling with Airbnb so I'm looking forward to re start hosting again. 

Slightly extroverted; I enjoy time with my family and friends. 
Foodie, traveler, single, marketer, tennis player, walker and music lover ; I enjoy films, eating chocolate, photography... and never pass up a good story.

name: illuminated studio in Roma-Norte, NO kitchen
description:
Fully independent room and on suite bathroom with its own private entrance, but no cooking facility (electric heater available). Fully remodelled in October 2017, including window mosquito net. It has a sofa-bed (120 cm/47"), a computer working-space (desk) and a built-in closet. Perfect for lone travellers.

The issue related to the boiler has been solved. It was due to a delayed maintenance in the context of the Covid situation.

The space
A non-shared and fully independent en-suite room in a building in Colonia Roma-Norte, 2 blocks from Alvaro Obregon and Plaza Rio de Janeiro.
It does NOT include kitchen nor accessible to a kitchen.

Other things to note
There is a coffee-shop/bar/restaurant on the building ground-floor. The neighborhood is full of many other restaurants, coffee shops and bars.

neiborhood_overview:
Roma-Norte is one of the best and trendiest neighbourhoods in Mexico City. It is close to everything, culturally, and fun.
La Roma is filled with fading 1910s and 1920s architecture, sun-dappled parks, and a wide variety of eateries that cater to the city's young and trendy. The capital's elite was concentrated here at the turn of the 20th century. In the late 1990s a tide of artists, entrepreneurs, and foreigners brought a wave of energy. La Roma is now home to a group of important art galleries, as well as some of the city's best restaurants.

name: Private room at charming B&B, South of MX City
description:
Enjoy this peaceful, completely private and upgraded bedroom at my house. Located in one of the best residential neighborhoods in the south of the city, this is a safe, quiet place minutes away from shopping, restaurants & transportation. Ideally located for students looking for long term stays! WiFi/parking included.
To accomodate larger groups I have another bedroom in the house that can accomodate up to 2 more guests: https://es.airbnb.com/rooms/7886849?preview

The space
Welcome to my home!
My house is nestled in a quiet residential neighborhood, close enough to great restaurants, shops and quick transportation, but far enough so you can have a great night sleep in a safe, family friendly environment. With a charming park view from your window and my small back garden, my place is great for a convenient overnight stay or for students looking for long term housing to attend any of the universities located nearby.
My guests will enjoy a private,
host_about: I am a retired professional living in Mexico City.  I now work form my home as a travel agent. I love gardening, reading, going to museums and exploring this great and fun city.
neighbourhood: Mexico City, Distrito Federal, Mexico
amenities: ["Host greets you", "Essentials", "Microwave", "Hot water", "Lock on bedroom door", "Stove", "Free parking on premises", "Backyard", "Hair dryer", "Cooking basics", "Washer", "Refrigerator", "Hangers", "Fire extinguisher", "Kitchen", "Smoking allowed", "First aid kit", "Coffee maker", "Wifi", "Patio or balcony", "Dishes and silverware", "Shampoo"]
neiborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is mostly residential and very safe, but that doesn't mean it lacks food and entertainment options! A few blocks away from the house you can find various types of restaurants from typical mexican "comida corrida" spots, to sushi, hamburgers, bakeries and multiple street food carts. Also a few blocks away we have a big shopping mall, super markets and many public transportation stops that can take you to the typical touristic destinations.
For students, Tec de Monterrey University is a 5 minute bus ride, as well as UAM and even UVM has it's South campus nearby.
For more traditionally touristic destinations, we are closely located to the famous Xochimilco neighborhood where you can ride typical trajineras while listening to floating mariachi bands and eating mexican street food.
If you have questions or are interested in specific locations please don't hesitate to ask me!

A few blocks aways from the house you can find various types of restaurants from typical "comida corrida" mexican spots, to sushi, hamburgers, bakeries and multiple street food carts. Also a few blocks away we have a big shopping mall, super markets and many public transportation stops that can take you to the typical turistic destinations.
For students, Tec de Monterrey University is a 5 minute bus ride, as well as UAM and even UVM has a South campus nearby.
For more traditionally touristic destinations, we are closely located to the famous Xochimilco neighborhood where you can ride typical trajineras while listening to floating mariachi bands and eating mexican street food.
If you have questions or are interested in specific locations please don't hesitate to ask me!

Welcome to Roma Sur, one of the hippest neigborhood of Mexico city. Surprise yourself with its history and enjoy a delicious coffee in its restaurants and bars. It is one of the must-see neighborhoods in Mexico City. Art deco and nouveau architecture you will find in the neighborhood. Old house was remodeled a few years ago. Close to CONDESA and ROMA (center and north), between the CHILPANCINGO metro station and CENTRO MEDICO. Supermarkets, farmers markets, bars, cafes. It has common areas.

The space
It is a classic house of ROMA (sur) neighborhood that has been built for more than 60 years. A few years ago it was remodeled and has been equipped step by step. It has common spaces, in general, is confortable and fully equipped. The room is 10 metre and square, has TV cable, a full size bed, a big closet and totally wooden floor. This room DOES NOT HAVE a window to the outside.

Guest access
The house has areas of common use: living room, ki

It's green, quiet, walkable, with a lot of nice places to eat and very practical as everything is close by: food, market, supermarket, pastry shops, metro stations to name only a few.

There's a taxi stand 2 blocks away

o Organic shops, supermarket, butcher, corner shop and local cafes within 1 km radius

o Main Metro station CHAPULTEPEC 8-10 minutes away

o Private TAXIs (SITIO) 2 blocks away

o Free Cycle scheme (ECO BICI) on the street corner along with bike rentals some blocks down.

Napoles is centrally located making it easy to move North to popular Condesa and Roma and South to traditional and beautiful Coyoacan and San Angel.
World Trade Center is the main business center in Mexico City, only one block away from the building. Both WTC and Pepsi Center offer a variety of entertainment and business events, concerts and expos.
The world's largest mural, "La Marcha de la Humanidad," rises from the foot of the World Trade Center in NÃ¡poles.
Pennsylvania Street serves as NÃ¡poles' main commercial corridor, offering a nice and quiet walk through home-style restaurants and coffee shops.

host_about:
Easy going. respectful, friendly, reliable.
My first experience with Airbnb was in August 2014, as a guest, traveling to Chicago USA.
The experience was very good, so in September 2014 decided to join as a host, offering a couple of options and prices to stay in Mexico City.

I like that the guests enjoy their stay and their space, in total privacy.
My priority is to offer nice, clean, safe and well located place; at a  affordable rate.

I have always lived in Mexico City, I know it very well. It will be a pleasure to guide you and help you with any questions, suggestions that you require, or need that you have.
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Sencillo. respetuoso, amigable, confiable.

Me agrada que el huÃ©sped disfrute su estancia y su espacio, en total privacidad.
Mi prioridad es ofrecer un lugar agradable, limpio, seguro y bien ubicado; a una tarifa accesible.

Siempre he vivido en la ciudad de MÃ©xico, la conozco muy bien. SerÃ¡ un placer orientarte, sugerirte y ayudarte en lo que necesites...  si asÃ­ lo deseas.

name: Great room close to UNAM
description:
Beautiful large room for 1 or 2 guests, 10 min walking to UNAM, ITAM, SAn Angel, etc.
In front of the Chinese Embassy.
Close to Plaza Loreto, Excenaria, bars, clubs, cinemas, parks, cafes, street markets, traditional San Angel, Coyoacan, UNAM Stadium (Mexico 1968 Olimpic stadium)

host_about:
I am fluent in English and Spanish, lived in London a few years while studying my MSc.

In Mexico I studied at UNAM, which is within 8 minutes walking distance from our home.

I enjoy all kind of sports, specially racquet such as squash and tenis and also love swimming.

I am always in the mood for having an interesting conversation, laughing, going to a party, having a barbeque, going to the movies, meeting cool new people and showing the beautiful areas near us such as San Angel, Coyoacan and UNAM.

Our place is very convenient for international as well as local students attending UNAM or ITAM that require a friendly, safe, super clean and excellent located home.

We also enjoy hosting professionals that need a comfortable, friendly and safe place to rest during their stay in Mexico City.

name: Small room near Bellas Artes

The space
Its a room with an individual bed and a desk. Enough to rest and get confortable. The space is thought for only one guest and in the apartment I live with a friend and my pet parrot "Pepe". It's a LGBT+ friendly space and we have the room available a few days a month to help us with the rent.

The apartment is a third floor and there's no elevator so we recommend to have that in consideration if you have mobility problems.

On the street are a few gay bars, on weekend nights the street get's very busy.

Guest access
As a guest you can use the common areas like the living and dining room and the bathroom. The use of the kitchen is limited to store food

name: Cute 1 BR Apt . A few steps from Mercado Medellin
description:
My apartment is all you may want on your travel on Mexico City, in the hip neighboorhood La Roma Sur you have all the fun and culture you may want! Located on a quiet zone but close enough of all the fun. One fo the best places to enjoy the mexican way of life!

The space
My apartment is perfect to get to know Mexico City and the spirit of AirBnB, fully equipped for short and long stays, get away from it all and get to know a little more of Mexico's style. It is located in Colonia Roma, one of the most traditional neighborhoods of the city. With incredible parks and quiet streets to walk, there will be no lack of amenities.

Guest access
The entire apartment is yours for the whole stay, you have access to the roof in case you need to hang clothes after doing laundry.

Other things to note
Garbage must be taken out daily, from Monday to Saturday mornings it is left at the front door of the apartment.
host_about:

I enjoy all kind of sports, specially racquet such as squash and tenis and also love swimming.

I am always in the mood for having an interesting conversation, laughing, going to a party, having a barbeque, going to the movies, meeting cool new people and showing the beautiful areas near us such as San Angel, Coyoacan and UNAM.

Our place is very convenient for international as well as local students attending UNAM or ITAM that require a friendly, safe, super clean and excellent located home.

We also enjoy hosting professionals that need a comfortable, friendly and safe place to rest during their stay in Mexico City.

host_about:
A sensuous life!.
Travelling one of many passions.
My house is a temple,  love to share it with guests and treat them as they deserve. The energy one feels stepping inside the house is one of "nice to be home"
Guess I expect to feel the same, when I travel.  

As a guest I will respect every corner of the house I get in, as I shall expect the guests that stay at my house do the same -when staying at my place-.

Love to:
Eat, enchanting places, art, 
to read and a movie freak.

My favorite destinations are the cities that have tons to tell. Europe and Eastern Europe are my favorite destinations. Asia, blows my mind. When I travel to Asia, I would probably stay in one of the best venues. History is part of my life so as long as the destination has historical links, it will probably fit in this category. To be in contact with nature, but mostly the beach.

neiborhood_overview:
Colonia JuÃ¡rez is one of the oldest and most beautiful neighborhoods in central Mexico City. The neighborhood is shaped like a long triangle with the boundaries: Paseo de la Reforma on the north, Avenida Chapultepec on the south, and Eje 1 Poniente (Avenida Bucareli) on the east.

With palacios dating back to the Porfiriato period next to modern buildings and quiet streets lined with trees, the colonia is divided into 3 different quartes:
Korea Town (with lots of good eateries and karaoke spots)
Zona Rosa (Gay clubs, theaters and Reforma Avenue)
Barrio Gitano (the most residential area, where the spot is located)
Its pretty chill and safe. Young and old.

Roma-Norte is one of the best and trendiest neighbourhoods in Mexico City. It is close to everything, culturally, and fun.

La Roma is filled with fading 1910s and 1920s architecture, sun-dappled parks, and a wide variety of eateries that cater to the city's young and trendy. The capital's elite was concentrated here at the turn of the 20th century. In the late 1990s a tide of artists, entrepreneurs, and foreigners brought a wave of energy. La Roma is now home to a group of important art galleries, as well as some of the city's best restaurants.

Glorieta Insurgentes is just a few blocks from here.

name: You can get anywhere from here!
description:
HereÂ´s an option that will make your stay easier, cozier and smarter. This flat is strategically located to make your miles go further. Nice, secure downton strip. Everything thatÂ´s worth seeing is almost within walking distance. A truly great location and a very comfortable room with a Queen Size Bed. Excellent for business trips.

The space
My guests have experienced a peaceful atmoshpere that makes them feel at home immediately. There are windows in every room so you can never feel claustrophobic and the view in most of them is quite nice.

Guest access
Except for my bedroom the whole place is at your disposal.

Other things to note
ItÂ´s a pet friendly house and we keep it fur free and fresh, so I hope you like my cats because they love humans and enjoy having guests!
host_about:
Welcome to my world.  IÂ´m a people person and have shared my place with friends from London, Germany, Finland, Japan, Spain, France and USA. 
I am very proud of MexicoÂ´s heritage and cultural background and would love to share it with you. I work as a free lance communication consultant and I also enjoy practicing and teaching meditation and some other ancestral healing traditions. My place is warm, friendly and cozy.  If you choose to stay here I could help you design or optimize your stay in MÃ©xico City and join you or drive you around if you feel like it. If you (Hidden by Airbnb) where my flat is you will see that you are within walking distance from some of the most interesting sites like Chapultepec Castle and Park, Modern Art Museum, The Anthropologic Museum, Tamayo. And you can easily and safely walk move around day or nigh since this is a very privileged area. Wether you choose to stay here or not, I hope you have an amazing time while in Mexico.

neiborhood_overview:
Roma Norte is the go-to place in Mexico City. Everything is walkable, and it's full of great restaurants, bars.
It was urbanised in the 1900s as an extension of the City Centre, and still keeps lots of original buildings (have a look at the local architecture guide in the flat). It has recently undergone an extensive redevelopment to become one of the trendiest and hippest areas. It has become a focal point for art, culture, markets, bookshops, and quite a variety of bakeries, local & gourmet restaurants and bars, gourmet shops & markets, without losing its local charm. Art & crafts fairs take place every few weeks in the area and you can also do some vintage shopping and visit art galleries. Even though the neighbourhood is full of great bars and restaurants it still manages to be quiet and calm.
There are 2 supermarkets, 5 and 7 blocks away, and there are several mini-supermarkets within 100 metres distance, offering basic groceries, fruit and household items. There is als

name: A green view in Polanco
description:
This is a beautiful flat in Polanco area, just a few blocks away (most of them at walking distance) from trendy restaurants and shops, parks, supermarkets and shopping malls.

The space
The flat has two rooms, each with its own bathroom and walking closet, and accommodates four people comfortably. There is an extra bed in a service room if needed, also with its own bathroom. It has a beautiful private garden, with a deck, and is full of light. It also has a fully equipped kitchen and, if needed, space for parking two cars. The building has private surveillance day and night.

Guest access
If you stay with me, you can use the whole flat and the two parkings spaces. Common areas in the building are just for transit.

Other things to note
No pets or children allowed.
host_about: I work as an independent consultant. I love art and nature. I enjoy good food, good company, walking and exercising.

name: Perfect WFH/Staycation 3BR/2.5BA w/Interior Patios
description:
High speed internet.
Perfect for families or friends, this modern apartment is great located in hip Condesa district. Walking distance to "Bosque de Chapultepec", Roma, Polanco, museums, Castillo de Chapultepec.
2 mins walk to supermarket and very close to subway, citibike and public transportation.
It has 2 interior patios that gives a lot of natural light and makes perfect for leisure or business trip.

The space
460 ft. apartment. Includes a 140 ft. private roofgarden with Weber grill which you can use!
There is 2 different internet providers running at the same time. If one fails the other keep running. You will never run out of high speed internet.

Guest access
Full access to all areas of the 460 ft. apartment. Includes a 140 ft. private roofgarden with Weber grill which you can use! Also parking space when available. Please ask before confirming the booking.

Other things to note
Parking space

name: Awesome Mexican Loft with Best Roof Top in Condesa
description:
This is a lovely one bedroom - one bathroom apartment with a very comfortable King Size bed, a very fresh take on industrial style mixed with a rustic Mexican vibe and an awesome rooftop. You'll love spending time on the day-beds, and having fun with Argentinian grill and wood-fired pizza oven.

The space
The place is ideal for singles or couples. A third person can stay at the sofa in the living room but this only recommended for 1 or two days. It has a fully equipped kitchen with a gas stove with oven, fridge, appliances and utensils. It also includes Wireless High-Speed internet, premium Cable TV package including HBO. Everything is taken care off so that all you need to bring is your suit case!
The apartment is located 1.5 stories above ground level so it is very easy to access.
It has 3 main windows and a fourth one for ventilation in the bathroom all of which face the inner side of the building.

name: Spacious and Comfy Room with doublebed in Coyoacan
description:
This spacious room furnished with a desk and a cozy double bed is located two blocks from Tlalpan Avenue & thesubway station, it is very near the trendy Coyoacan neighbourhood & The National Art Centre. Markets, theaters, restaurants, plazas are all nearby.

The space
The building that houses the apartment has a nice view of the neighborhood. The space is very quiet (specially considering MÃ©xico City!). The welcoming living room has plants and comfy sofas made up of traditional Oaxacan Cloth. There is a guidebook to the city at your disposal. The kitchen is well stocked with everything you need to cook, and coffee and tea are free all day. We have a stove, a big fridge and plenty of space to put your groceries.

This is an ideal room for arty travelers and writers looking for alternative housing or just students looking for a cheap, fanciful place to stay.

There are two bathrooms in the apartment. One is used exclusively for the guests and the
host_about:
I like generating and participation in community, the relationship between art, yoga and daily life, and it is important for me to have an open home where people feel comfortable. I'm an open-minded person, I seek always to get to know people as they are and I'm against discrimination in any form.

Filmmaker, photographer, teacher of kundalini yoga and activist. I like to practice yoga, meditate, go take pictures, walk, meet new friends and colleagues. I love movies, go to the National Film Library is one of my favorite activities.

I am a visual artist by profession, but I got into the world of film and multimedia afterwards and really love it.
I am currently interested in the subject of human rights, in fact I am pursuing a diploma in HR.

In a 15-20 min. walk or 10 min. by bus you have Coyoacan area which has beautiful plazas and parks, various museums (like the Frida Kahlo Museum), tons of restaurants, bars and stores. In the area is the main market which has many stores of traditional handicraft and typical mexican restaurants. 5 min. walking there is the National Center of Arts which has constantly concerts, theatre plays and exbhitions. Also close is the national film library which shows constantly tons of movies from arround the world.

name: La Roma: Well Located, Cozy, 2BR, roof top view
description:
Our flat is in the heart of one of the most trendy areas in town. Everything is within reach for all tastes: restaurants, parks, sightseeing spots, art galleries...it's close to metro stations, bus stops and main avenues. It's an ideal place to move

The space
The flat is in a very safe building, we have 24 hour security.
It's very easy to move around: Condesa, Reforma, Polanco can be reached at walking distance, bus, taxi or evey by grabbing the underground.
The flat has 2 rooms. The main room has a walk in closet and at the end is the bathroom. The other room has its private bathroom right outside.

Guest access
Any guest would have access to the roof, which has a gorgeous view of Mexico city. It's a nice place to go read or have a drink while contemplating the stunning city.

If you are into cooking, there is a supermarket and a market 2 blocks away. Spices, oil or similar things are available to you in the kitchen.
host_about: I'm en engineer and work in a multinational company. I have lived abroad, in Italy, UK and Mexico. What these three countries have left me is my passion for food, culture, great conversation at the dinner table & a passion for travelling.

host_about:
I am a good person. I am 48 years old. I am quiet, homey, educated, responsable, I am concerned to do the right things so everyone is happy. I was born in the year 68. Sign: Leo.  I am artist, dance flamenco for 23 years, though I am dedicated to the logoterapy-psicoterapy, I love swimming and I practice it regularly. I like to spend time with my family.

* Traveling: trips that I've liked most had been "road trips". Travel a couple of hours on the road, find the historical centres of cities or walking arround small towns, enjoy the local gastronomy, landscapes, views, and make another trip to visit or spend the night in another town. Visit national parks, beaches and countryside. Also, I like visit museums, go to the tourist attractions and have chance to go to the theatre, ballet or that goes on. I also love cruises and ski holidays.

* Countries: my favorite country is Spain, the style of life, its gastronomy, its regions and natural beauties, its contrasts and itss people 
I love Europe. I studied in England and Scotland when I was 17/18 years old, so  I'm an Anglophile's too. 
I also love Portugal, France, Italy, Switzerland, Croatia, Germany and the Scandinavian countries 
I love to visit someday the Greek Islands. Turkey, Poland, and other regions of France and Italy that I've still been missing  as Brittany, Normandy, La Provence, La cÃ³te du Rhone, or la Calabria, Sicily and Sardinia...  
Iâve also got fascinated by the French Polynesia. 
New Zealand, Australia and Japan are of my favorite countries in other continets,as well as  Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand and Indonesia.   
I like the United States, specially New York, San Francisco, Boston and Miami. I also loved Canada, but I still missing the West Coast.
In Latin America I like, especially, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Costa Rica and I would like to visit Colombia.  

* In the gourmet aspect, I love I love Spanish gastronomy. Also French cuisine, Japanese, Italian and the Mexican. 
* I couldnât not live without flamenco, without my beloved ones, without swimming lessons, without travelling and enjoy good food and the pleasures of life. 
* Books. The ones I like most are the biographical of great men and wome in history, for example: "Winston Churchill", "HernÃ¡n Cortez", Felipe II, Francisco I, "Maximiliano and Carlota", "Porfirio DÃ­az", "Enrique VIII and his six wives". "Elizabeht I, Mary Queen of Scots". on the other hand: "The Dorian Gray Portrait", "Another twist", "Crime and punishment", "The dog in the manger", "la Celestina", "flowers in the attic,"the night is Virgin","friends that I lost, "was yesterday and I don't remember", "existential psychotherapy"and "The gift of therapy" of Yalom, among others.  * Films. 
* Favorite films. "Dangerous Liassons", "Devil were's Prada", "Te doy mis ojos", "La Comunidad", "American Beauty" "Mujeres al borde de un ataque de nervios", "Somewhere in Time", Anne of the Thousand days", "The Others", "The Sound of Music", "The Shining", "Shindrel List" "Fried Green Tomatoes", "Coma", "El hada ignorante", "The Queen", "El hijo de la novia", "Elsa y Fred", "Camila, "The Black Swan", "Nosotros los Nobles", "Como agua para Chocolate" "The Graduate", "Little Miss Sunshine". "Transamerica"....
*Tv shows. "Downton Abby", "Breaking Bad", "Miss Marple",  "Gran Hotel", "Club de Cuervos, "The Forsyte Saga", The Nanny"...
* My favorite dishes: Iberian ham, baby squid in its ink, abanda rice, Wellington fillet, eels, fabada, salami, fondue, spaghetti Carbonara", Vienershnitzel, good burgers, sandwiches or gourmet snacks, and Mexican tacos. Desserts: custard, homemade flan napolitano, Santiago cake, Nantes, Missippi Mug foot, the apfell strudel, profiteroles, crepes Suzette, cherries jubilee, arroz con leche, Catalan creme, the marzipan and nougat.
* As guest I consider myself to be very  clean, tidy, formal, responsable, not noisy. I do like confort and cleaness, a peaceful and not noisy enviroment, kindness and gentleness, a good firm bed, a nice pillow, black out, TV system and WiFi, and sometimes central heating, a fan or A/C if  necessary.
* As host I like to please my guests as much as posible. I like to do my best so they could feel very confortable and satisfied. Iâd like to know their purpose of their stay and the type of holidays, interests or kind of food they like, if they are vegeterian or not, If they come for pleasure or for work,  if they need some special requirments in other to find out locations or sites they might find important for their stay.

* Quotes that I like: 
"Blessed are those who know how to give without remembering it and receive without forgetting it".
 "Blessed are the men of good will".
 "Never despair still in direst distress, because of dark clouds fall fertilizing and clean water." 
"The limits of my language are the limits of my world."  
âA master is made by practice".
 "Bizarre is our condition here on Earth. Each of us comes for a short visit without knowing why, yet sometimes we believe guess a purpose". Albert Einstein 
"The largest democracies weakness is economic fear." Albert Einstein
 "if what you say is not more beautiful than silence, not tell". Arab proverb. 
 "All the passions are good while one owns them and all of them are bad when enslave us." 
"If all the bad people were black and all the good white, from what color would you be?... because I would have striped skin."

description:

Use of the laundry facilities (washing and drying machine) its only available for weekly

neiborhood_overview: Large community, comfortable, friendly neighbors. This is an authentic Mexican neighborhood and you will get to experience it first hand. You can easily walk to two markets: Dalia Market (7 minutes) and San Cosme Market (10 minutes) to do grocery shopping like the locals. Forum Buenavista, a pretty big shopping centre that features major retailers, cinemas, restaurants,  theaters, and a gym its close by (1km). Ecobici is found within 12 minutes of the premises for your convenience. Around the neighborhood, you will find bakeries, tortillerias, butcher's shops, and many other places to experience authentic Mexican traditions and cuisine.
