name: 2bed/bath BEST LOCATED in the heart of Polanco
description:
The space
This charming hardwood floored apartment consists of two bedrooms, one with a full size bed and the other one with two twin beds which can also work as a king size bed.
It has two and a half bathrooms, fully equiped kitchen, laundry, living and dining room, office area.

Our beautiful apartment is located in a historic building sorrounded by streets filled with culture, in one of the safest neighborhoods.
Just one block away from parque Lincoln and Mexico Cityâs best hotels, Galleries, casual and sophisticated shops, all kind of cafÃ©s, bars and restaurants including great culinary offerings.
It's also two blocks away from Av. Presidente Masaryk, Mexico's fashion main avenue.
Bosque de Chapultepec, Auditorio Nacional (it has a metro station), Museo de Arte Moderno, Museo de AntropologÃ­a, Museo Tamayo, Castillo de Chapultepec, and CDMX zoo are also a few blocks from it.

neiborhood_overview:
Polanco is one of the most famous and exclusive districts in Mexico City. The neighborhood is notable because of its cultural diversity and has been historically preferred by the descendants of Spanish, Ashkenazi Jewish, Lebanese, among others.
Some of the wealthiest families in Mexico and Latin America do live in Polanco and a very long list of politicians, celebrities, artists and businessmen call the area home.

The neighborhood is also populated with expensive offices, restaurants, museums, luxurious stores and shopping malls. Its Avenida Presidente Masaryk is the highest-priced street and the one with the most upscale boutiques in Latin America. It is compared by some to Beverly Hills' Rodeo Drive or New York City's Fifth Avenue.

The area is located in the Miguel Hidalgo borough of Mexico City, situated north of Chapultepec Park and consisting of five official neighborhoods ("colonias").

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polanco,_Mexico_City

Description:
Welcome!
host_about:
Hola, soy arquitecta y diseÃ±adora de interiores. Me encanta visitar amigos y conocer nuevas ciudades. DespuÃ©s de hospedarme con Air bnb y vivir la experiencia, he decidido convertirme en anfitriona, ademÃ¡s de ser una viajera. No hay nada mejor que estar en un lugar que te permita sentirte como en casa. Comprar deliciosa fruta en el mercado del barrio, conseguir hermosas flores frescas en el la tienda local, dar un paseo por las calles arboladas en las tardes, salir por un cafÃ© en la maÃ±ana o una copa por la noche, y siempre estar a la vuelta de la esquina. Esto es lo que encontrarÃ¡s en mi casa, tuya ahora. Muy emocionada de ser parte de esta comunidad.

Hello, I am an architect and interior designer. I love visiting friends and meet new cities. After staying with Air bnb and live the experience, I have decided to become host, besides being a traveler. There is nothing better than stay at a place that allows you to feel the "home" experience. Buy delicious fruit at neighborhood's market, get beautifull fresh flowers with the local vendor, take a walk on the tree-lined streets in the evenings, go out for a coffe in the morning or a drink at night, and always be just around the corner. This is what you'll find in my house, yours now. Very exciting to be part of this community.

neiborhood_overview:
Accessible walking distance, residential area, in city center; close to restaurants, cafes and shops; Spanish school, bookstore and beautiful church in the neighborhood; tree-lined streets, yoga-pilates studios nearby and jogging parks; Trendy nightlife; convenience store across the street, easy access to public transport networks.

If you love exercising and don't want to break your routine when you travel, you can jogging in the nearby parks, or go to a yoga studio or pilates (many places allow you to pay per class), even take salsa lessons!

If you want to learn more about Mexico, there is a library and a Spanish school a few steps in the neighborhood.

If you come to the city in a business trip, Reforma, Polanco and the World Trade Center are realy close. And you can make this business trip to a home experience. And in the meantime explore one of the trendiest neighborhoods.

Enjoy Mexico City!!

name: Casa Moctezuma Mexico D.F.,Coyoacan
description:
Casa Moctezuma is an architectonic jewel, a space where the original architecture of the house -built in the early XX century- and a contemporary design come together harmoniously, creating a unique space in the heart of the historic and very save neighborhood of CoyoacÃ¡n. Each of our rooms constitute a particular universe habited by objects and fine details chose with affection and good taste.

The space
The rooms we offered are duplex lofts with other a King or Queen Size bed. All of them are equipped with a private bathroom, a small living and dining room, wi-fi, a small refrigerator and kitchen, a tableware set, and portable heating. Some of them has a microwave.

A few blocks from the house you have: La Casa Azul where the extraordinary painter Frida Kahlo was born and died, the CoyoacÃ¡n Vivarium, the National Film Institut âthe best place to watch the most contemporary creations of young talented directors from Mexico and worldwide-. Close

neiborhood_overview: Roma Norte is undoubtedly one of the most famous neighborhoods of the city, characterized as artistic, cosmopolitan and bohemian. The area is very safe with an array of amazing restaurants offering every type of cuisine you can imagine, hipster-run coffee shops, bars, art galleries, and beautiful parks. When not skating, spraying, or conceptualizing, Roma Norte's residents share late night cigarettes and cold drinks outside the neighborhood's cantinas and art galleries.

name: Cool downtown apartment in Reforma Avenue
description:
My place is a nice 2 bedroom apartment down town Mexico City it has a gym and a deck up staris, it is two blocks away from archaeological site called Tlatelolco one of my favourite places in the city. It is also 10 min away from the Town square where you can find a bunch of museums, teathers, restaurants, bars, dancing halls the cathedral, Bellas Artes Palace, Alameda central and more archaeological sites, guided tours, you name it!

The space
My place is very quiet, close to downtown and it has a great view from the roof garden.

Guest access
Make yourself at home :)

Other things to note
On Sundays there is a famous market near by, the vintage or antique shops are crossing the street just in case you want to check out.

description:

You will love the location and neighborhood.

The space
Family enviornment, i live with my 2 little Pug (Polka and Totopo) but dont worry, none of us will have access to your room.
Cleaning of the room is included once a week as well as changing sheets and towels.
The room is available for one or two persons (there is only one double bed) in the second case (2 persons)you will only have to pay $100 extra pesos per night.

Guest access
You will have access to the kitchen whenever you need to cook or prepare a meal as long as you clean up when you finish. You also have other options nearby like coffee shops, restaurants and tacos at almost every time. There is also a laundry room 20 steps away.
There is one bathroom that we will share.

You will never be bored in neither one. 

 I would love to help you feel at home away from home & to discover these two very different & amazing cities!

name: 3 STORY TOWNHOUSE in the HEART of COYOACAN!
description:
Our casita is located in the beautiful and historical Coyoacan. Home to the greatest artists, Coyoacan is safe, quiet and perfect for walking and biking. Our house is very close to delicious restaurants, fun bars, markets, parks, subway stations and the famous Frida Kahlo museum. The neighbourhood is full of Mexican art and culture and the house is cozy and lovely! Our casita is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and well behaved furry friends (pets).

The space
Our 3 story Mexican house is on a quiet street. We've done our best to make it comfortable, very clean and cute for you. The living room space is cozy, the kitchen is fully equipped, the bedrooms are comfortable and the terrace is a great space to read, take a nap or sunbathe. We hope you can feel at home and enjoy your stay.

1st floor: One half bathroom. Fully equipped Kitchen with brand new fridge, oven and nespresso machine. TV Room with Cable and NE
host_about: My boyfriend Stacy and I work in the film industry. We own this house together and used to live there before we decided to move out and become AirBnB hosts. We love film, animals, biking, hiking, reading, traveling and eating nice vegan food. Since we travel so much we know what it is like wanting to stay somewhere really nice but yet comfy and homey. We decided to decorate our Casita in a warm and cozy way, with all the amenities to make you feel like you live there but also as practical and comfortable as a hotel room. We will always do our best to accommodate your needs because we want to make sure you're happy and relaxed!

neiborhood_overview:
Our cute house is located in the first neighbourhood of Mexico City, the beautiful and historical Coyoacan. Home to the greatest artists, including Frida Kahlo, Coyoacan is safe, quiet and perfect for walking and riding a bike. Our casita is two blocks away from the main square where you'll find tons of delicious restaurants and bars, both traditional and upscale. The house is also two blocks away from the Coyoacan farmer's market (open everyday) and four blocks away from the Frida Kahlo museum. There's several parks in the area including the "viveros" which is also two blocks away and has running trails.
Youâll love our place because the neighbourhood is full of Mexican art and culture and the place has great ambiance.

name: CASA DELFINO 5 BED 3SH BATH
description:
Beautiful house in the Condesa, built in 1937. Recently restored and redecorated.
It has five bedrooms, three bathrooms and all services. Fully functional. Located in a very quiet street, but conveniently close to all kinds of restaurants, bars, cafes and beautiful parks, among many other attractions. Great for families or groups of friends up to 10 guests.

The space
The house has 5 bedrooms, 4 of them with king size beds and the remaining one with a queen size bed. All rooms have closets and safety box.
Four rooms have a work table.
In the common area we have a desk with multiple drawers, to work comfortably.
A full bathroom with toilet, sink and shower on the ground floor and 2 full bathrooms also upstairs.
Full kitchen including gas oven and laundry center.

Guest access
The house is absolutely private for the guests. You can access the backyard and enjoy the garden table.

neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa is one of the most beautiful and historic neighborhoods in Mexico City. Here you will find beautiful parks, streets and buildings more than 100 years old.
The variety of alternatives to eat is amazing, from the local market to the most renowned restaurants.
And for me, the most incredible thing: You have all this just a few steps away, enjoying at the same time that you are in a house located in a quiet and nostalgic street.

Also, there is a construction going on in front of the apartment. Some days it can be quite noisy.

neiborhood_overview: You can find the best mountain biking and hiking trails in Cumbres del Ajusco National Park. Cumbres del Ajusco National Park is one of many national parks near Mexico City, DF. The Ajusco is known for its high elevations reaching 3,900 meters (12,795 ft) above sea level and is visible from any part of Mexico city. The park is characterized by pine-oak forests and high mountain grassland. Cumbres del Ajusco means "watered grove peaks", an appropriate name for this mountainous region covered with lush green forest with many flowers due to a fair amount of precipitation.

neiborhood_overview:
Colonia RomaÂ is one of the coolest neighborhoods in Mexico City.Â Â 

Best transportation options inÂ Colonia Roma?Â 
While public Metrobuses run down the main roads that border Roma, your best bet for within the neighborhood is walking or biking. Walking down the wide, colorful avenues gives you the time and space to enjoy the architecture, discover hidden boutiques, and take in the energy from this incredible neighborhood.Â 
For more efficient transportation, utilize the bike lanes along Avenida de los Insurgentes. For bicycle rental options, there are numerous EcoBici stations scattered throughout Roma. In order to use EcoBici, you must have a card, so they arenât ideal for tourists with a limited travel window. Weekend or week-long travelers would have better luck with private bike rentals likeÂ Casai Bikes, available to rent in select Roma Norte units.

Markets are a dependable feature of all neighborhoods in Mexico City. Roma is home to some of the best!Â Â

host_about:
MyPlace Leisure Homes

Â¡MI CASA ES TU CASA!

When you stay in one of our properties, youÂ´ll get to experience our history, culture and people with an immersive feel of our traditions all with a touch of design to immerse yourself in our culture. Whether a âlucha libreâ decored flat in Centro HistÃ³rico, an ultra luxury condo in Acapulco, or a restored colonial house, we handpick every one of our homes to give them a unique charm and character and all of them with modern, first-rate amenities and handcrafted local comforts so you can truly relax when visiting Mexico.

With concierge services, hotel amenities, and you can truly relax and live just like youâre at home, but better..

As a hosts, we focus on the little details so you can have the best stay possible. 

As a guest, I know what hosts go through and feel like, so I'm very respectful of the places I rent. 
As a person.. I love my wife and son!! I have a little dog called Carola (which is a mini xoloizcuintle). I love to travel and consider myself a foodie.

name: Cool room in classic house.
description:
Great classic house built in the 1940s. One of the last great houses of La Napoles.

Excellent location, close to wtc mexico, metrobus line 1, route 80 to subway metro station san pedro de los pinos and many Ecobici stations.

2 cats live in the house

The mattress is very firm some people may not like it.

Read additional rules THOROUGHLY.

The space
One of the last great houses of La Napoles. A few blocks from the WTC and the "poliforum" station of the metrobus. Excellent location, surrounded by restaurants, near Superma Dakota, market on wheels on Sundays, Cinemex in the wtc, parks, shopping malls.

The mattress is very firm and may not be suitable for everyone. There is no curfew, we only ask for discretion when entering and leaving.

Guest access
Garden, bathroom, spacious fully equipped kitchen with fridge, storage, and some appliances, pots, pans, dishes, silverware

name: Superb private bedroom in the heart of Condesa
description:
Placed in Amsterdam Av. at Condesa, one of the most beautiful streets of Mexico City, you will find a quiet bedroom with private bathroom and walkin closet. You will have a nice terrace to relax, have breakfast dine in or chill out. Kitchenette equipped with microwave, sink and dinnerware. Just a few steps we have two supermarkets, a regular one and an organic one.
Around we have nice cafes, restaurants, shops and also you will find a lot of organic places to shop or eat.
YOU WILL LOVE IT.

The space
The house was built in the 30's, has a bit of influence of the Art Deco. It is located in a very quiet spot of the house so you will be able to hear birds in the morning and crickets at night.
Near supermarkets, parks, shops and restaurants.

Guest access
Inside your bedroom:
Smart TV with Netflix & YouTube

Common areas:
Kitchen area with microwave and sink, fully equipped.
Indoor patio.
Place to dine

A brilliantly located, spacious flat in between two lovely parks in La Condesa.
Easy walking distance to all the best bars & restaurants, kids play parks, free public gyms, boutique shops, galleries, malls, cinemas, museums and supermarkets but far enough to get a good nights sleep. Close to Metro Sevilla & Sonora Metrobus stop. Ideal for couples, families, groups of friends and professionals. Three bedrooms with queen-size beds in each, lockable doors and a generous, bright communal area.

The space
The apartment is on the 3rd floor and has three good-sized bedrooms with a large closet in each one. Please note that there is no elevator so is not ideally suited to anyone with mobility issues. Each bedroom has its own lock for privacy. The communal areas include the kitchen, dining area and living-room as well as the two bathrooms.

neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa is one of the 'trendiest' areas in Mexico City and also one of the safest. It's full of great wee places to explore on foot including a wealth of bars, restaurants, cafes, galleries and shops.
Parque MÃ©xico and EspaÃ±a are great for wandering around or exercising - both have free open air gym facilities and jogging tracks - and are the perfect option if you have kids as they both have excellent play parks and are just 100 meters from the apartment.
If you fancy a bit more of an adventure the massive Chapultepec park is just 1km away, it's brilliant for running, walking, cycling or visiting the museums and huge free zoo inside it.
Roma neighbourhood is also just a stone's throw away which is another great neighbourhood, that's where you'll find Mercado Medellin, our favourite market for all things food related.

name: Comfortable Apartment
description:
Comfortable apartment of 160m2, 3 large bedrooms, living room, kitchen, 1 bathroom and 3 small patios.

You will love my place because of the comfort of the beds, the kitchen, the cozy space, the high ceilings and a beautiful decor with rustic Mexican furnishings and Mexican handcrafts.

My accommodation is good for young people, exchange students, couples, adventurers, business travelers, families, groups of up to 6 people and pets (only in the patios).

The space

description:

The space

Guest access

Other things to note

neiborhood_overview:
The center of Coyoacan is a place of magic and mystic place that allows you to get an idea about the cultural diversity of MÃ©xico. We are located in the Old Town "la Conchita", where Hernan Cortes built a farm and a Church that was his home during the early colonial times. Today is a beautiful museum and restaurant. We are also very close to "Casa Frida Kahlo", artistic icon in the history of Mexican art.

Today Coyoacan is one of the most important cultural centers of the country, is an area filled with museums, cafes, bookstores, theaters, bars and restaurants where young people, families and intellectuals throughout the city come to enjoy and share with all visitors from other countries.
The cobbled streets and old buildings downtown Coyoacan, with its beautiful Kiosco generate an unforgettable stay.

MyPlace Leisure Homes

Â¡MI CASA ES TU CASA!

When you stay in one of our properties, youÂ´ll get to experience our history, culture and people with an immersive feel of our traditions all with a touch of design to immerse yourself in our culture. Whether a âlucha libreâ decored flat in Centro HistÃ³rico, an ultra luxury condo in Acapulco, or a restored colonial house, we handpick every one of our homes to give them a unique charm and character and all of them with modern, first-rate amenities and handcrafted local comforts so you can truly relax when visiting Mexico.

description:

La habitaciÃ³n estÃ¡ dentro de una hermosa casa en condominio estilo colonial californiano con estructuras de techos altos, ventanas en arco, pisos con duela, loseta y espacios expresivos de la Ã©poca que hacen de ella una opciÃ³n inmejorable para reunir historia, comodidad y estilo.

Es una zona rodeada de pequeÃ±os comercios que transforman la colonia en un âpueblitoâ en medio de la gran Ciudad de MÃ©xico.

The space
Tenemos una oferta diferente para ti, brindamos el concepto de hotel boutique para lograr una estancia mÃ¡s Ã­ntima e independiente. Entendiendo que es bueno no siempre adecuarse al ritmo de vida o usos y costumbres del âanfitriÃ³n en su casaâ, te recibimos, alojamos y permanecemos tan cerca de ti como necesites, pero sin habitar la casa contigo. host_about:
Somos una pareja muy unida, divertida y responsable, nos gusta mucho disfrutar de una tarde de pelÃ­culas o libros, asÃ­ como de una buena noche de fiesta, baile y salud!

Para nosotros la familia y los lazos entre personas conforman lo mÃ¡s importante en la vida, asÃ­ mismo, respetamos la diversidad en absolutamente todas sus expresiones, gustos y preferencias, como dirÃ­a Octavio Paz, a donde yo soy tÃº, somos nosotros.

Nos consideramos cÃ¡lidos anfitriones, orgullosos de nuestro paÃ­s, cultura y gente.   Nos agrada que personas de otros lugares vengan a conocer y vivir entre otras experiencias, las riquezas naturales, culturales, urbanas y culinarias que MÃ©xico ofrece a visitantes y habitantes.

Como pareja pretendemos aprovechar al mÃ¡ximo las oportunidades que nos da la vida, y porque no la tecnologÃ­a.   Es por ello que aprovechamos Ã©sta plataforma para brindar una buena opciÃ³n de hospedaje al que lo necesite, y de esta forma darnos mutuamente la mano.

PermÃ­tanos ser su apoyo en el momento que lo requieran y tengan por seguro que serÃ¡n bienvenidos.

The space is small but perfectly located in the rooftop of a lovely building, it has its own private entrance, a small kitchenette, a working table, a full bathroom and a very comfortable sofa-bed. If you're looking for some down-time, the roof-terrace is a great place to catch some sun and relax.

The space
The small studio has an independent full bathroom, a kitchenette and a comfortable sofa-bed that can fit up to two people.

Guest access

Other things to note
Please note that because the room is in a rooftop, there are a few flights of steps to take. The access can be narrow for big bags.

name: Cuarto cerca del Plaza Condesa , ambiente familiar
description:
A menos de una cuadra del Plaza Condesa, que es conocido por promover conciertos y diferentes actividades culturales.
Toda clase de restaurantes en el area y muy cerca de medios de transporte como el metro, el metrobus e incluso el Turibus que ofrece diferentes paquetes para visitar los lugares mas relevantes de la Ciudad de Mexico, incluyendo las Piramides de Teotihuacan.
El vecindario es bastante seguro para caminar de dia o de noche.

The space
El ambiente que ofrecemos en casa es familiar, vivo con mi madre y nuestra meta es hacerlos sentir como en casa, somos gay friendly pero siempre tomando en cuenta que no se permiten visitas despues de las 11 pm , sabemos de antemano que a veces las mujeres se sienten inseguras de donde pueden quedarse, pero aqui seran tratadas como si estuvieran quedandose con su famlia y sin temor alguno de que alguien les falte el respeto. Estaremos muy agradecidos si nos dan la oportunidad de ser sus anfitriones y les asegu

name: Live in Colonia Roma, CDMX
description:
Located in Colonia Roma, a classic district of the city turned into one of the most trendy areas to visit in Mexico City.
Surrounded by local life, parks, markets, local shops, restaurants, street food, night spots, short distance to other tourist spots, neighbor trendy districts and close enough from city downtown.
Nice and peaceful, co-living, co-working, traveling, networking environment.
As a 15 year tourist/service experienced host I will be a very helpful and safe host during your stay.

The space
In the house/apartment (tricky to explain, youâll get it when you get here) there are three bedrooms:
My bedroom and two private guest rooms (for up to two guests) available for rent in different listings.
Contact me if you would like/need to rent both or more (read forward).

You would occupy one of the guest bedrooms while the other is usually hosting another guest(s). Both rooms offer and are equipped with pretty much the same
host_about:
Eager to host  and meet new people like you everyday and give my best advice about your adventure in Mexico City.
I lived working in the service/tourism business for 5 years in Playa del Carmen Mexico, a tourism industry focused city in the Mexican Caribbean, where I learnt the tourism business and met many travelers like myself and you.
From my experience working in the tourism industry and as a traveler as well I know first hand how helpful a good tip can be in regards to where to go, places of interest, where to eat, how to get around and the importance of knowing where to go in case of a health emergency and how to stay safe. 

I currently live in Mexico City, work has brought me back to the city where I am from.
As a local and having been around for nearly 40 years I know the city extremely well. If you need any tips on where to eat, where to go, how to get around, and maybe more important WHERE NOT TO, WHEN NOT TO, and HOW NOT TO make sure to ask. I want my guests to have a great time in my place, my city and my country.

Traveling and meeting new people is my passion. I have been to many places (not enough yet) and met loads of amazing people along the way. Been in the tourism/service business for nearly 15 years, in direct contact with foreigners and expats for nearly 25, so I can communicate and advise about pretty much anything with particular great expertise. I will be a very helpful and safe host during your stay.
Unless Iâm out of town or in exceptional circumstances, very few times I donât meet my guests. I've hosted around a thousand guests from all over Mexico and the world, with a thousand different stories. I will always be interested to hear yours, happy and eager to meet travelers like you and will try to make your stay at my place as pleasant as possible.

description:
Make Mexico City your new home, while doing your best work. This beautifully decorated apartment, featuring a comfortable working space, has everything you need to be inspired and productive while exploring one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in the city.

Take a break and walk to Amsterdam Avenue or grab coffee at Parque Mexico, both just around the corner.

The building has 24/7 security, an impressive roof with a fully-equipped gym and a 360 view of the beautiful Mexico City.

The space
Apartment's layout and decor gives it a homey atmosphere perfect for working during the day, and enjoying it in the afternoons. Spacious, fully-equipped kitchen with all essentials, dishwasher and more. Separate room for laundry with washer/dryer. The TV room is a great nook for relaxing and whining down. Dining table with 8 seatings, perfect for stay-at-home dinners. And the living room next to the balcony overlooking the street is another great area f

neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa is an area of Mexico City that, together with Colonia Roma, it is designated as a "Barrio MÃ¡gico TurÃ­stico" ("Magic Neighborhood for Tourists"). Together they are often referred to as CondesaâRoma, one of the most architecturally significant and bastion of the creative communities of the city.

The area is considered to be fashionable and popular with younger businesspeople, students and pet lovers. It features a large number of international restaurants, bars and nightclubs.

"Condesa" means "countess" and it is named after MarÃ­a Magdalena DÃ¡valos de Bracamontes y Orozco, the Countess of Miravalle, whose lands stretched from what is now Colonia Roma to Tacubaya.

name: Cozy Spacious Room Downtown.   Mi casa es tu casa!
description:
Hola! We are a Mexican-Italian couple who love to have guests over and show them the city.
We live in a historic neighborhood close to pretty much everything: the Centro HistÃ³rico, typical markets, beautiful libraries, shopping malls and public transport.
Our flat is very spacious, bright and cozy; the room has a comfortable double bed plus a sofa-bed and a big desk, so it has enough space for working or relaxing. Ideal for couples and adventurers.
Benvenuti! :)
ESP-ENG-ITA spoken

The space
We love our apartment, we put a lot of effort in making it nice and cozy and we feel that youÂ´ll enjoy it too!
The flat is pretty big, there is a large living room with couches, a smart tv and a record player. ItÂ´s the ideal place for eating, relaxing and socializing if you feel like it. YouÂ´ll have access to the kitchen, which is small but well equipped. The same goes for the bathroom, which is kind of tiny but cute and functional. MarianaÂ´s wo
host_about:
Hey there! 
I'm Mariana, I have been living downtown for four years now andI I love it. IÂ´ve been traveling quite a lot in Mexico and abroad and I love getting to know people from all over the world. I like the main idea behind Airbnb of being able to experience life in other cities rather than just being tourists. I'm very down to earth and we like it cheap and easy so thatÂ´s what I'm trying to offer. I like TV series with convoluted story lines (The Wire, anyone?), Hip-Hop, Marxism and sleeping.

neiborhood_overview:
By walking around in our neighborhood you'll get a feeling of what authentic daily life in Mexico City is like. It is an historic and popular part of town, so that means you'll have many cheap and tasty options for trying out traditional food and drinks. You can't miss a taste of pulque from a small but nice pulquerÃ­a just a few steps away. You'll also have the chance to try one (or several, if you dare) of the renowned, half-meter long, "quesadillas machete". One of the biggest flea market areas in all of Latin America is at walking distance, as is the Centro HistÃ³rico with all its touristic attractions (Palacio de Bellas Artes, Alameda, ZÃ³calo, Torre Latinoamericana, the Regina walking street...). The area is also a music and counter-cultural hotspot, thanks to the El Chopo flea market being held here every Saturday.
-

name: Centric studio with shared terrace in la NÃ¡poles
description:
Comfy little studio near the WTC and Condesa at the rooftop of the building. Ideal for one person, a couple or two friends who wish to take the best out of Mexico City.

The space
The studio is located at the rooftop of the building and has a nice terrace to hang out and relax. The ambiance and the view are swell.

The studio has a full-sized bed, a kitchen, a personal bathroom, a breakfast bar furniture, a TV and multiple services included.

The building was built by my grandpa in the 60s and has an eclectic style inside. Back then it was not common to install elevators, that's why the way up is only through stairs. The stairs are pretty light (in my opinion), as the apartment is located in the 5th floor.

The location is great! Really centric and close to public transportation. It is two blocks away from the World Trade Center and the Condesa neighborhood is just 3km away.

The neighborhood is well known and contemporar
host_about:
Hi! I am an internationalist and I work in an NGO in Mexico City. 

I love food, culture, arts, coffee, books, traveling, learning new languages and meeting people from other cultures and countries. 

Because of my studies, I have lived in Germany, France and Switzerland. I worked for the UN in Geneva for three months. Since then Iâve been traveling around the world, from Argentina to Nairobi. 

Right now I work with indigenous peoples in Mexico. Nice to meet you!

neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa is cool and trendy with abundant street life, plenty of restaurants, bars, parks, art, shops and so much more. If you like running outdoors, you are right next to Parque Espana or Parque Mexico where you will find many (and probably me) that are out for a run in the park. My place is also close to La Roma, the bohemian neighborhood next door, worth visiting as well and you are 10 minutes (car) away from Polanco and about 20 minutes away from Zocalo (approx. depending on traffic). On Sundays, the area (mainly Reforma) closes for car traffic and everyone goes out running and biking or rollerblading on the main streets that connect these neighborhoods. It's a great way to visit the city.

I feel it's safe to walk around day and night. There are always people around. As anywhere in the World, being careful and aware is always helpful.

The space

Entendiendo que es bueno no siempre adecuarse al ritmo de vida o usos y costumbres del âanfitriÃ³n en su casaâ, te recibimos, alojamos y permanecemos tan cerca de ti como necesites, pero sin habitar la casa contigo. La habitaciÃ³n cuenta con
host_about:
Somos una pareja muy unida, divertida y responsable, nos gusta mucho disfrutar de una tarde de pelÃ­culas o libros, asÃ­ como de una buena noche de fiesta, baile y salud!

Para nosotros la familia y los lazos entre personas conforman lo mÃ¡s importante en la vida, asÃ­ mismo, respetamos la diversidad en absolutamente todas sus expresiones, gustos y preferencias, como dirÃ­a Octavio Paz, a donde yo soy tÃº, somos nosotros.

Nos consideramos cÃ¡lidos anfitriones, orgullosos de nuestro paÃ­s, cultura y gente.   Nos agrada que personas de otros lugares vengan a conocer y vivir entre otras experiencias, las riquezas naturales, culturales, urbanas y culinarias que MÃ©xico ofrece a visitantes y habitantes.

Life and family business are anchored in the community, contrasting with the modern style that marks trend of the neighborhoods like Condesa, a little more to the north. In EscandÃ³n, the grandchildren frequent the same shops that their grandparents frequented, and the grandparents leave their grandchildren in the same schools that their children attended.

name: Comfort with a gorgeous view on Avenida Amsterdam
description:
Lovely 9th floor apt with floor to ceiling windows. Situated between Roma Norte and Condesa, you'll be a short walking distance from many of the city's best bars, restaurants, night clubs, and art galleries. You'll also be close to Chapultepec, Paseo la Reforma, Parque Mexico, and a short Uber ride from the Centro HistÃ³rico. Whether looking for an adventure or a quiet stay, aquÃ­ tienes tu casa.

Important to note: I still live here! You'll find clothes in the closet and some personal items.

The space
In addition to the apartment the unit has access to a 19th floor roof garden with an even more expansive south-facing view of the city. Lawn chairs and umbrellas are up there for relaxing.

Guest access
Sorry, no guests, just you and your partner if you're traveling with one.
host_about:
Gringo from San Diego working at a fintech company here in Mexico City. Work and social travel keep me moving around a fair bit. I love connecting with people where they live and work and am super low maintenance. As a host it's a joy being the guy to put a roof over your head and I hope you love the place and the neighborhood as much as I do.

Airbnb suggests a life motto. Here's one: Don't be afraid to start. Just making a beginning is often the hardest part.

name: CHARMING  PRIVATE GARDEN ROOM
description:
You will love my space for its location, the privacy of the room, which is independent from the main house, and its cozy garden to sit and enjoy the green area.
Condesa is known for its cafes, bookstores, restaurants, as well as for its cultural and night life. Condesa shares its border and bohemian spirit with Colonia Roma.
Ideal location to visit Chapultepec, the Museum of Anthropology, the entire Reforma Ave. area of Museums, the Zona Rosa and the downtown area.
CHECK-IN FROM 3pm to 11pm

The space
A comfortable garden room with a queen size bed, bedside tables, lamps and a single sofa. The room also has an en suite bathroom for the exclusive use of guests. The room opens to a lovely garden in one of the nicest suburbs in Mexico City.
Due to the COVID pandemic the thorough cleaning and sanitization of the room is guaranteed for every stay.
CHECK-IN FROM 3pm to 11pm.

neiborhood_overview: The neighborhood is unique because it is strategically situated near every point of interest, but away from traffic, caos and smog.  It is a very Green Neighborhood, upscale and full of vegetation and trees.   Most of the worlds embassies are located here.  The neighborhood dates back to the 1920s, when it was founded with the name Chapultepec Heights.  The neighborhood is located in the center of other importants parts of the city therefore you can get anywhere quickly.  The areas that you can get to quickly by walking, biking or Uber are: Polanco (10 min Bike/ 5 min Uber), Condesa (15 min Uber), Roma (15 min Uber) , Santa Fe (15 min Uber), Tecamachalco (10 min Bike) , Centro Historico (15 min Uber), Interlomas (20 min Uber).

name: Cozy Studio with shared terrace in la NÃ¡poles
description:
Comfy little studio near the WTC and Condesa at the rooftop of the building. Ideal for one person, a couple or two friends who wish to take the best out of Mexico City.

The space
The studio is located at the rooftop of the building and has a nice terrace to hang out and relax. The ambiance and the view are swell.

The studio has a full-sized bed, a kitchen, a personal bathroom, a breakfast bar furniture, a TV and multiple services included.

The building was built by my grandpa in the 60s and has an eclectic style inside. Back then it was not common to install elevators, that's why the way up is only through stairs.

The location is great! Really centric and close to public transportation. It is two blocks away from the World Trade Center and the Condesa neighborhood is just 3km away.

The neighborhood is well known and contemporary, it shares multiple similarities with the Condesa neighborhood in terms of cultural histo
host_about:
Hi! I am an internationalist and I work in an NGO in Mexico City. 

I love food, culture, arts, coffee, books, traveling, learning new languages and meeting people from other cultures and countries. 

Because of my studies, I have lived in Germany, France and Switzerland. I worked for the UN in Geneva for three months. Since then Iâve been traveling around the world, from Argentina to Nairobi. 

Right now I work with indigenous peoples in Mexico. Nice to meet you!

name: Nice room in charming beautiful house.
description:
Bienvenido a casa y bienvenido a uno de los barrios mÃ¡s famosos y alternativos en Ciudad de MÃ©xico. Rento una habitaciÃ³n en una preciosa casa de los aÃ±os 30 de estilo art-deco, restaurada y reamueblada totalmente en 2015. Se ubica en la calle de General BenjamÃ­n Hill es una calle con camellÃ³n tranquila. La casa es muy acogedora con sÃ³lo dos habitaciones, cuarto de tv, pequeÃ±a terraza, mezzanine como despacho, salÃ³n-comedor, cocina y dos baÃ±os y medio.

The space
A mÃ­ espacio lo hace Ãºnico el que es acogedor, buen espacio y bonito, soleado, cÃ³modo, privado, con buen lugar para closets para guardar objetos personales, baÃ±o privado, en una casa bonita de los aÃ±os 30 intervenida con buen gusto en una excelente ubicaciÃ³n de la HipÃ³dromo Condesa, por ser una calle con camellÃ³n y menor circulaciÃ³n.

La habitaciÃ³n es de 14m2. CÃ¡lida, con persianas de madera, cama matrimonial, espejo de piso a techo frente a la cama, burÃ³, pequeÃ±o escritorio con taburete, Ã¡rea
host_about:
I am a good person. I am 48 years old. I am quiet, homey, educated, responsable, I am concerned to do the right things so everyone is happy. I was born in the year 68. Sign: Leo.  I am artist, dance flamenco for 23 years, though I am dedicated to the logoterapy-psicoterapy, I love swimming and I practice it regularly. I like to spend time with my family.

* Traveling: trips that I've liked most had been "road trips". Travel a couple of hours on the road, find the historical centres of cities or walking arround small towns, enjoy the local gastronomy, landscapes, views, and make another trip to visit or spend the night in another town. Visit national parks, beaches and countryside. Also, I like visit museums, go to the tourist attractions and have chance to go to the theatre, ballet or that goes on. I also love cruises and ski holidays.

* Countries: my favorite country is Spain, the style of life, its gastronomy, its regions and natural beauties, its contrasts and itss people 
I love Europe. I studied in England and Scotland when I was 17/18 years old, so  I'm an Anglophile's too. 
I also love Portugal, France, Italy, Switzerland, Croatia, Germany and the Scandinavian countries 
I love to visit someday the Greek Islands. Turkey, Poland, and other regions of France and Italy that I've still been missing  as Brittany, Normandy, La Provence, La cÃ³te du Rhone, or la Calabria, Sicily and Sardinia...  
Iâve also got fascinated by the French Polynesia. 
New Zealand, Australia and Japan are of my favorite countries in other continets,as well as  Hong Kong, Singapore, Thailand and Indonesia.   
I like the United States, specially New York, San Francisco, Boston and Miami. I also loved Canada, but I still missing the West Coast.
In Latin America I like, especially, Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Costa Rica and I would like to visit Colombia.  

* In the gourmet aspect, I love I love Spanish gastronomy. Also French cuisine, Japanese, Italian and the Mexican. 
* I couldnât not live without flamenco, without my beloved ones, without swimming lessons, without travelling and enjoy good food and the pleasures of life. 
* Books. The ones I like most are the biographical of great men and wome in history, for example: "Winston Churchill", "HernÃ¡n Cortez", Felipe II, Francisco I, "Maximiliano and Carlota", "Porfirio DÃ­az", "Enrique VIII and his six wives". "Elizabeht I, Mary Queen of Scots". on the other hand: "The Dorian Gray Portrait", "Another twist", "Crime and punishment", "The dog in the manger", "la Celestina", "flowers in the attic,"the night is Virgin","friends that I lost, "was yesterday and I don't remember", "existential psychotherapy"and "The gift of therapy" of Yalom, among others.  * Films. 
* Favorite films. "Dangerous Liassons", "Devil were's Prada", "Te doy mis ojos", "La Comunidad", "American Beauty" "Mujeres al borde de un ataque de nervios", "Somewhere in Time", Anne of the Thousand days", "The Others", "The Sound of Music", "The Shining", "Shindrel List" "Fried Green Tomatoes", "Coma", "El hada ignorante", "The Queen", "El hijo de la novia", "Elsa y Fred", "Camila, "The Black Swan", "Nosotros los Nobles", "Como agua para Chocolate" "The Graduate", "Little Miss Sunshine". "Transamerica"....
*Tv shows. "Downton Abby", "Breaking Bad", "Miss Marple",  "Gran Hotel", "Club de Cuervos, "The Forsyte Saga", The Nanny"...
* My favorite dishes: Iberian ham, baby squid in its ink, abanda rice, Wellington fillet, eels, fabada, salami, fondue, spaghetti Carbonara", Vienershnitzel, good burgers, sandwiches or gourmet snacks, and Mexican tacos. Desserts: custard, homemade flan napolitano, Santiago cake, Nantes, Missippi Mug foot, the apfell strudel, profiteroles, crepes Suzette, cherries jubilee, arroz con leche, Catalan creme, the marzipan and nougat.
* As guest I consider myself to be very  clean, tidy, formal, responsable, not noisy. I do like confort and cleaness, a peaceful and not noisy enviroment, kindness and gentleness, a good firm bed, a nice pillow, black out, TV system and WiFi, and sometimes central heating, a fan or A/C if  necessary.
* As host I like to please my guests as much as posible. I like to do my best so they could feel very confortable and satisfied. Iâd like to know their purpose of their stay and the type of holidays, interests or kind of food they like, if they are vegeterian or not, If they come for pleasure or for work,  if they need some special requirments in other to find out locations or sites they might find important for their stay.

* Quotes that I like: 
"Blessed are those who know how to give without remembering it and receive without forgetting it".
 "Blessed are the men of good will".
 "Never despair still in direst distress, because of dark clouds fall fertilizing and clean water." 
"The limits of my language are the limits of my world."  
âA master is made by practice".
 "Bizarre is our condition here on Earth. Each of us comes for a short visit without knowing why, yet sometimes we believe guess a purpose". Albert Einstein 
"The largest democracies weakness is economic fear." Albert Einstein
 "if what you say is not more beautiful than silence, not tell". Arab proverb. 
 "All the passions are good while one owns them and all of them are bad when enslave us." 
"If all the bad people were black and all the good white, from what color would you be?... because I would have striped skin."

neiborhood_overview: CoyoacÃ¡n  refers to one of the 16 boroughs (delegaciones) of the Federal District of Mexico City as well as the former village which is now the boroughâs âhistoric center.â The name comes from Nahuatl and most likely means âplace of coyotes,â when the Aztecs named a pre-Hispanic village on the southern shore of Lake Texcoco which was dominated by the Tepanec people. Against Aztec domination, these people welcomed HernÃ¡n CortÃ©s and the Spanish, who used the area as a headquarters during the Spanish conquest of the Aztec Empire and made it the first capital of New Spain between 1521 and 1523. The village, later municipality, of Coyoacan remained completely independent of Mexico City through the colonial period into the 19th century. In 1857, the area was incorporated into the Federal District when this district was expanded. In 1928, the borough was created when the Federal District was divided into sixteen boroughs. The urban sprawl of Mexico City reached the borough in the mid 20th cen

name: Lovely, bright and quiet apartment in La Condesa
description:
Lovely, luminous and fully refurbished apartment in a quiet street of La Condesa. Only five minutes walk from the street Michoacan that is renowned for its restaurants and attractions.

The apartment has a large bedroom with a terrace that fills with sunshine in the afternoon. The large living room has a couch and a smart TV. A perfect space to relax and hang out. The kitchenette is equipped with a refrigerator, a stove and a large dining table. The bathroom has a shower and a dressing room.

The space
The apartment is fully independent and with a private entry, but it is attached to my house. This allows me to be close to my guests if something comes up.

Please bear in mind that the apartment is on a second floor and there is no elevator.

Guest access
You will have private access to a fully equipped kitchenette, wifi internet and cable TV.

If you are staying for more than one week, we provide you with a clea
host_about:
I am a contented 70's year old physician who worked at UNAM - the main University in Mexico - for many years.

I am now retired, my children are grown-ups and I own a lovely house in Colonia Condesa.

I have multiple interests and activities that fill my schedule since my retirement. I work as a therapist, I study Eastern philosophies, I love to go to the movies and to concerts, to travel and to spoil my grandson.

I am looking forward to meet all interesting people who want to enjoy the peace of this quiet place in the heart of Condesa.

The apartment is right in the middle of La Condesa and Roma Norte, which nowadays are the coolest neighborhoods in the city, and due to its central location, you can easily get in a five-minute walk (through tree-lined streets) to the most vibrant areas of Condesa, Roma or Zona Rosa.

name: Sunny and cozy apartment in la Roma
description:
Beautifully furnished two-bedroom apartment with plenty of light and all amenities. The apartment is close to wonderful restaurants, bars, coffee shops, art galleries and shops of all kinds. It is walking distance to the supermarket and fruit and tortilla vendors. Two televisions with full internet. Two full bathrooms. The area is well knowns as the Roma-Condesa area and it is filled with gastronomic options and nightlife, parks as well as close to the hop-on hop-off tour bus of the city.

The space

neiborhood_overview: Mexico City's Centro HistÃ³rico is a place that can not be defined with just one world. Magical, could be, but not even that world woulb be enough to talk about its enigmatic personality. It's like a mosaic scene in constant change of a colorful kaleidoscope where they converge an variety of cultures, traditions, architecures, artistics movementes, etc. Visiting this city means visiting a lot of destinations, all of them coexisting in harmony that interwaves in its streets, its people, its tourists as well as its buildings, parades, festivals. They are many words and experiences in just one place, in different instants. Between one instant to another the experience you may have will be completely different. That's Mexico City. That's why it would never be enough find it a description. You have to live it.

name: Delightful Spot, Perfectly Located
description:
Nestled in beautiful col. CuauhtÃ©moc, this silent, high ceiling apartment offers a respite from the bustle. A block from Reforma and Insurgentes, yet tucked in a deliciously diverse residential area. Stone throw away from the best sushi in the city and the most scrumptious tacos de canasta corner. Coffee by the park, feel the cityâs beat on Reforma, bike to hip Juarez, Santa Maria la Rivera, Downtown, Condesa, Roma or Polanco in 15. Embassies and hotels surrounding makes for a safe spot.

The space
Art cinema or block busters? Steak or fish tacos? Drugstore run, out of milk? Got it. Amazing sunday market, late night drink sitting outdoors, french bistro, shopping mall, best Japanese, Korean bbq? That too! Quick grabs at the quesadilla stand, a cup of the best coffee in town (shout out to Cucurucho!) and a 1 dll stand of fresh squeezed juice? Just out the door.
Come back from the city bustle to a silent niche and unload.

name: Beautiful  room in el Centro HistÃ³rico
description:
This is a large private room in a corner apartment of Mexicoâs Cityâs Central Historic district. It is only 4 blocks from El Zocalo, La Catedral, Bellas Artes, and myriad of great cafes, restaurants, markets, shopping and amazing bakeries! The room gets plenty of light.The living room, bathroom and kitchen are shared. Spanish and English is spoken in house. Short walk to metro.
Amplia habitaciÃ³n, se comparte departamento con una pareja amigables y respetuosos.

The space
This is a large room in a beautiful and historic area of the city. From here you can walk to El Zocalo, Bellas Artes and many museums, tourist attractions, restuarants and bars. We are two blocks from La Regina, a pedestrian-only street with wonderful restaurants, bars, cafes, and great for people watching. We are also only a 15 minute metro ride from La Roma and Condessa. From our apt you take public transport to anywhere in the city.

Guest access

name: Cozy â¥ Full Apt. in Coyoacan. Great for long stays
description:
Cozy and clean apartment where you can have a relaxing time. We are very strict with the sanitization of the entire place before arrival and we provide weekly cleaning. We also offer self check-in, for the safety of our guests.
Short distance to Coyoacan, and a few blocks away from shopping centers and commercial areas. Two blocks from metro Zapata (UNAM or Zocalo in less than 30 minutes).
We have good discounts for long stay, just use airbnb week or monthly reservation to see pricing

The space
Cozy apartment with great relaxing vibe, perfectly for couples and intimate travelers, or family with one kid.

The apartment is decorated with Mexican craft and local art - so you connect with the culture straight with your arrival.

Kitchen, dining room a living room, super equipped. You will find anything you need for cooking, reading and entertaining.

Its in 3rd floor

This is a NON SMOKING apartment.

description:
We are a group of three young friends who live together and we want to enrich our experience being host in the airbnb community. Our department is very silent and confortable. We live in Condesa, where you will find parks, restaurants and cool places to visit, at just a 5 to 10 mins walk.

The space

name: Cozy apartment in the heart of downtown (shared)
description:

2022 UPDATE
At the moment I'm not living in Mx City, so Erick (my best mate) will be living there and he'll be your host alongside Martina (dog), PepinÃ³t (cat) and Muish (axolotl).

The space
I love my flat. I try to keep it ravishing all the time. I love listening to music, reading and watching movies so, naturally, most of the arrangements have been made to enjoy those sorts of things. I also like to cook, so maybe I can make something special to welcome you :)

The building is very beautiful as well, it's a very unique building in the city, you'll love it!

Guest access
Feel like home. There's no restrictions really so, do as you wish.

name: Apartment in the heart of Roma
description:
Welcome to Roma Neighborhood!

Cozy/quiet place, well-located, one block away from the Fountain of Cibeles and four blocks away from Condesa neigborhood.

Surrounded by parks and excellent restaurants, you will love the place for its excellent location and the cultural diversity you will find across the streets, as well as the characteristic historic buildings of the neighborhood.

Other things to note
*Good WiFi connection for working.
*The apartment is in a 1st floor with option to access through the elevator (very confortable and secure)

neiborhood_overview:
The artsy, bohemian neighborhood of Roma makes up a mostly residential area of Mexico City located 15 minutes away from the Centro Historico (Historic Downtown) and 5 minutes walking from Condesa neighborhood.
Roma offers a pleasant change of peace from Mexico Cityâs busy downtown.

Spend the day wandering around the neighborhoods, taking in the cool atmosphere and admiring the beautifully restored Art Deco architecture, wide parks and welcoming plazas.

This area is also great for browsing the local art galleries, shops and markets. The Mercado Medellin (Medellin Market) in Roma is famous for its attractive food displays and tasty fare.

Roma is also known for having some of Mexico Cityâs best shopping, dining and nightlife.

name: Sunny 1 BR Apt | Condesa
description:
This stylish apartment is located in the Condesa neighborhood, perhaps the most vibrant in the entire city. Its privileged location will allow you to enjoy everything that Condesa has to offer. You can walk through its streets, get drunk by the bohemian atmosphere that breathes in them and of course, you will spend incredible days while you relax in the comfort of the apartment.

The space
Do not be fooled because it is a one-bedroom apartment, this space can accommodate up to 4 people at the same time because it has a double bed and in the living room, there is a sofa bed of the same size.
We know that a perfectly equipped kitchen is essential to make your stay as comfortable as possible, so we have everything you need.
You can also enjoy coffee in the morning, while watching the world pass from the balcony.

The space is ideal for solo travelers, couples, or families with up to three children. There are 3 beds and 2 sofas. The sofas do not convert to bed. They can be used, however, as a bed for small children.

The space

It is located in a residential area that is bustling by day, quiet at night and safe. The room has a single bed, closet, desk, private bathroom. I provide towels and sheets, weekly cleaning. Each guest has an assigned space to store their groceries. My location is south of the city. We are a 5-block walk from the Nativitas subway station, which is the fastest way to get dow

You can try the delicious Cielito Querido CafÃ© coffee a few steps from home or eat a delicious cut of meat with a bottle of wine in the Argentine Grill. The best place to eat "garnachas" (typical street Mexican food) is very close in the "Sopes de la Nueve". We have supermarket delivery, Ubereats, Rappi. Our colony was built on the land where an old hacienda was located around 1960 and the houses were sold to the community of journalists of that time.

name: Casa Q BnB
description:
My house is only 15 minutes drive to the Benito Juarez International Airport and 25 min to downtown Mexico City where you can visit the main square (Zocalo), Palacio de Bellas Artes, Templo mayor museum and many stores and restaurants. Experience the true, local Mexico custom and cultural. . Foro Sol and racetrack are close by. If you don't like to drive, we can help you to use Uber Taxi online service. Subway station is 10 minutes walk. Free WiFi & Netflix.

The space
My house is located in a safe, quiet, sophisticated neighborhood. The host grew up in a traditional Mexican family. You will feel at home with a warm Mexican flavor and hospitality. We always be happy to help you.

Guest access
The BnB room is located on the top floor with access to the balcony. It has a double bed and shared bathroom. You can also use the living room, bathroom, dining room and sun room on the main floor.

Trained pets under 10kg are welcomed

Recently renovated building, and immaculate interior design, the apartment only has new fixtures and furniture.

The space
These are two âjoinedâ apartments of 3BR each. The stairwell connecting them is on the inside so you will have complete privacy while not having to walk out and back in to move between apartments.

Good to notice are the 2 independent kitchens/living rooms, one per floor, if you wish to have breakfast separately or be more efficient with your time.

This place is great for large groups or families that want to stay together, enjoy Mexico City, and still pay a gray price per night for the number of rooms.

Apartment located in Delegacion Cuahtemoc, home of Colonia Roma, Condesa and Juarez, which are the most interesting neighborhoods in the city as it relates to culinary offerings and trendy spots. It is also very close to the Historic City Center and to Polanco, the financial hub.

The apartment is located on Colonia Buenavista, one of the most centric places in the city. Here you will find the many contrasts of a big city, from fine restaurants to sadly street beggars and street noise.

Mexico City is booming with interesting choices and great experiences, but be mindful and cautious as in any neighborhood.

name: Just Refreshed -  Secluded - Patio and Terrace
description:
This house has a vintage character. The high ceilings make the space bigger, the house orientation and the oversize windows provide very good light. The house is very quiet and intimate the patio and the terrace are perfect for enjoying the mild weather of the city. The location forms a triangle with the Condesa and Roma Norte being 2 blocks from Insurgentes street and half block from Medellin market. The deco is intentionally sober to create a relaxing environment.

The space
The house is on ground level with the benefit of spacious rooms. The kitchen and the dinning room have access thru the patio. Ideal for three and comfortable for five as well, this is an independent space but in combination with house on the front (1920 tile house I) could be a excellent place for a big group travelling together.

The main bedroom has a queen bed and a walking closet, this room has a little patio on the back that works as a private relaxing space.

The
host_about:
I will treat my guest as I would like to be treated when I travel making their experience an enjoyable one. 

The places I offer are meant to be comfortable, clean and have specific locations for visiting the city. Every place is unique and it has been thought for enjoyment of the guests.

name: Gorgeous Apartment in Colonial CoyoacÃ¡n!
description:
Our 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment is located in the heart of Colonial CoyoacÃ¡n, one block from the Conchita Chapel (the oldest in the Americas), one block from the F. Kahlo Park, and 5min walk from the historic center CoyoacÃ¡n. This gorgeous apartment is extremely quiet, with a beautiful vista, lots of natural light, and close to two metro lines. Supermarket, restaurants and cafes two blocks away. Everyone is welcome in this apartment (we welcome long term rentals)-you will love staying here!

The space
The apartment is extremely quite and receives lots of sunlight, with a beautiful view from the living room. And the apartment is located in one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in Mexico City. The apartment has a landline from which you can call for FREE (unlimited phone calls) to any place in Mexico and anywhere in the world--yes, you read it correctly: unlimited free phone calls to anywhere in the world! We look forward to host you soon!

Four blocks away is the famous Plaza Hidalgo, the most visited plaza in Mexico City after the ZÃ³calo. La "Casa Azul" (Frida's Museum) is within 15 min walk- or a five minute cab ride. description:

The top floor of the building only has two apartments (and you are one of them). The elevator takes you straight up. Just opposite the apartmentâs entry door, there is a large open rooftop deck that you have access to this common area of the building. Subways are 4 to 8 blocks nearby the appartment.

description:
Warm and spacious apartment in the Heart of Xochimilco; Within walking distance of lots of tourist attractions like "Las Trajineras", and downtown Xochimilco and many more in the area.
The apartment is the perfect place to Walk and return to a pleasant and confortable space to rest with family or friends.

The space
The private apartment has 2 Bedrooms, a spacious living room with a sofa bed, a sunny Terrace and the Kitchen full in colors and nature, It is the perfect Mexican corner in the south of the Mexico City to stay.

Guest access

The Living rom has a sofa-bed and Hammock to read and relax.

neiborhood_overview:
Xochimilco is full of History, it is a neighborhood that you can walk, where you will find in the streets and alleys small plazas and old churches which festivities all year.

The market of Xochimilco is located 4 Blocks away, one of the largest traditional markets in Mexico City with regional food, and traditional objects.

One of the small piers, where you can take a Trainer to tour the famous chinampas is located 2 blocks from the apartment, the main piers are 10 and 15min. walking.

All tourist attractions are available any day of week, all year round.

name: Near WTC, bright & comfy home!
description:
This studio-like apartment is ideal for couples, tourists or business travelers. Bright and comfortable, fully equipped to make you feel at home. Safe and quiet area, perfect to easily move around the city. Many restaurants, coffee shops and services within walking distance (dry cleaning, banks, movie theaters, malls). Only one block away from WTC and Pepsi Center, easy access to public transport.

The space
This bright apartment is located on a 4th floor with a nice view to WTC. Wood, walls and ceilings were recently remodeled. There's a fully equipped kitchen and washing machine. Hot water, iron and a nice working desk. 32" tv with cable and internet with 10 mbps. The building has security 24 hrs a day and elevator, there's one parking space available.

Other things to note

Napoles is centrally located making it easy to move North to popular Condesa and Roma and South to traditional and beautiful Coyoacan and San Angel.
World Trade Center is the main business center in Mexico City, only one block away from the building. Both WTC and Pepsi Center offer a variety of entertainment and business events, concerts and expos.
The world's largest mural, "La Marcha de la Humanidad," rises from the foot of the World Trade Center in NÃ¡poles.
Pennsylvania Street serves as NÃ¡poles' main commercial corridor, offering a nice and quiet walk through home-style restaurants and coffee shops.

name: Unique colonial apartment / Historic neighborhood
description:
This private apartment, in colonial style, is a semi-independent part of our property. Located on the second floor, full of light, cozy, and with a fabulous view of an exuberant garden decorated with sculptures. Planned for travelers from all over the world with a taste for discovery.

Beautiful and pedestrian-friendly San Angel is full of restaurants, coffee shops, art galleries, museums and art markets. The apartment is an easy walking distance to metro bus and University (UNAM) subway line.

The space
This apartment is designed for travelers who come to Mexico because of its culture, as well as business people. The apartment lends itself for prolonged stays. It is located on the second floor with a wonderful and relaxing view to trees.

Fully furnished, with many commodities, to include TV, internet connection, kitchen/dining room, living room, and bedroom with its own private bath.

Guest access

We are a working couple. Hector is a medical doctor and Marie-Louise signs her artwork Olyn. We have travelled all over Mexico and other parts of the world. Aside from travelling we are scuba divers and nature lovers. Olyn reads very much and loves music, and simply lives.  Hector is always updated on local and international politics and the cultural events of the city. 
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

name: Hector's Crib Roma Norte
description:
Beautiful and modern apartment in the heart of Colonia Roma, Mexico City, one of the most trendy neighborhoods in the city.
In Hector's crib you will find everything you need for your stay to be splendid and wonderful.
Within walking distance you will find great restaurants, nightlife and cultural sights as well as grocery stores around the corner.

Guest access

name: Guest Suite in Historic Architecture Home
description:
La Roma, so vibrant is the perfect spot at the city with many cultural, touristic and gastronomy options. Great located at the heart of the city and also with easy access to public transportation.
My historic property is located in the heart of Roma, in front of one iconic park of the area. Redesigned some years ago, you will notice architecture intervention if youâre into Design.
Even is located in semi ground level you can enjoy natural light.
I Live in the property and host more guests.

The space
La Roma is the perfect spot at the city with many cultural, tourstics and gastronomy options. Great located at the heart of the city and also with easy access to public transportation.

host_about:
Iâm a digital creator & Community Leader at Airbnb
Follow my project :  @ AkevinoAlMundo 
For me, this journey of life is about people, places and questions. Sharing my places makes me happy as being an avid traveler for years gave me the vision of what we need when traveling. I feel honored helping you during your stay at Mexico, no matter if itâs for pleasure, work or any reason. Feel free to ask as much as you need before and during your stay. Iâve been hosting for 4 years with more than 5,000 travelers over the world. 
My life changed in 2015 when I traveled to South Asia for some months. There I discovered how big is our world and the millions of opportunities that life offers to us every time, every moment. That trip changed my perspective of what is the meaning of life. Why?  While traveling, I felt the need of sharing my stories with friends and family through social media, and thatâs why choose to continue this adventure of creating content. Then I stared writing for magazines and later a personal travel blog. 
Now life is about that: Travel, love, stories and sharing. 
Being an Airbnb host gave me the perspective of how places and experiences can connect people. 

Hoping to find new and great stories together.

My Travel project name: âA Kevino al mundoâ on Social Media and Web. 
IG: @AKevinoAlMundo 
Feel free to follow the adventures.

name: SUNNY APARTMENT + PRIVATE TERRACE
description:
Sunny apartment with private terrace, (2 Bedrooms/1.5 Bathrooms). Few blocks from grocery stores, coffee shops, restaurants and bars. Located in one of the most touristic, lively and vibrant zone of the city. One block from Reforma and less than a mile from Alameda Central. Perfect spot for you to explore the city and walk around. Has a convenient store downstairs where you can buy snacks, food & drinks.

The space
Location is everything in this big city, and being just a few blocks from the most iconic spots of the city is priceless. If you like nightlife and knowing a city from its heart these will be a great spot for you. Our apartment is cozy and nicely decorated, and it is fully equipped to make your stay more than pleasant.

Guest access
Comfortable linens, great quality mattresses and some basics will be available. Great speed WiFi, fully equipped kitchen with everything you need to cook a complex meal or just a sandwich and a coffee.

name: Cosy safe loft for 1-2 4 digital nomads in midtown
description:
55 m2 cosy apt. Ideal for 1-2 people. Modern decoration- new building in the completely restored Alameda area. Very well located at the heart of Mexico City (midtown).

Front desk, Concierge and security staff. Small gym in the basement included.

2 Metro lines, 2 Metrobus lines, and 2 bycle stations nearby.

If you like busy areas during the day and quiet at night this is the place.

Thea area has some of the best museums in the city, traditional crafts markets, restaurants and bars.

The space
Thereâs a small groceries store back the street or a fine market nearby so you can prepare your own meals during your stay. If you are not up to cook remember there is a cafeteria in the building so you can get something anytime. Itâs practically like a hotel.

Guest access
-Laundry between the 6th and 7th floor
-Gym on the basement.
host_about:
Hi travelers! I am a Mexican Mkt, PR consultant and now becoming a writer. I had the privilege to study some courses in Cuba, Spain and Germany a couple of years ago and since then I can't stop traveling.

Countries that I love most, including my country:
Italy
Mexico
Portugal
India
Turkey

Cities that I love most:
Bangkok
Berlin
Cascais
Istanbul
Lisbon
London
Madrid
Mexico City
New York
Santorini
Tokyo

What I like to read: any novel, although lately I have been very interested in ny book that allows me to understand a country and its culture.

Love to practice sports and eat a loooooot of pastries, bakery and fruits. 

I rarely go out at night. Definitely not a party man, rather chilly atmospheres. 

;)

Pictures of Mexico City and some trips? Follow me on (Hidden by Airbnb) @ugovalpad

name: Guest Suite in Redesigned Historic Home
description:
The room is unique and also de house. Private bathroom for you. The place is a beautiful historical house of mexican colony of 1900. It has a lot of history and soon the place will have access to the roof top. Also you can use the common areas as the kitchen or the patio.
I hope you really enjoy your stay at my beatiful city.

Kitchen and patios.

Feel free to ask advices.

La Roma is the best spot in the city and is full of history. Restaurants, bars, museums, galleries, malls, parks, public transportation, and more are all accessible nearby. This area is the popular for young people and artists from many countries.

Bike, metro station, metrobus station. Taxi or uber.

The apartment is the basement of this beaufitul casona of la Roma. The location is great because you have access to public transportation so easy. The apartment has 3 rooms and i live in one. We are building some stairs that will connect to the roof garden.

host_about:
Iâm a digital creator & Community Leader at Airbnb
Follow my project :  @ AkevinoAlMundo 
For me, this journey of life is about people, places and questions. Sharing my places makes me happy as being an avid traveler for years gave me the vision of what we need when traveling. I feel honored helping you during your stay at Mexico, no matter if itâs for pleasure, work or any reason. Feel free to ask as much as you need before and during your stay. Iâve been hosting for 4 years with more than 5,000 travelers over the world. 
My life changed in 2015 when I traveled to South Asia for some months. There I discovered how big is our world and the millions of opportunities that life offers to us every time, every moment. That trip changed my perspective of what is the meaning of life. Why?  While traveling, I felt the need of sharing my stories with friends and family through social media, and thatâs why choose to continue this adventure of creating content. Then I stared writing for magazines and later a personal travel blog. 
Now life is about that: Travel, love, stories and sharing. 
Being an Airbnb host gave me the perspective of how places and experiences can connect people. 

Hoping to find new and great stories together.

My Travel project name: âA Kevino al mundoâ on Social Media and Web. 
IG: @AKevinoAlMundo 
Feel free to follow the adventures.

name: Charming Loft with Sunny and Private Terrace in CoyoacÃ¡n
description:
Now that we are reopening for travel be confident that we follow Airbnbâs enhanced cleaning protocol with standardized guidelines for cleaning and sanitation before each stay. Health always comes first!
Enjoy calm and beauty at this bright loft located in a quiet cobbled-stoned alley in the heart of colonial CoyoacÃ¡n. Its little details would make you feel like you are home. Sip your morning coffee or relax in the terrace after a hectic day in the city.

The loft is located on top of the main house in a quiet cobble-stoned alley, yet within walking distance of nice restaurants and bars in the center of Coyoacan. The neighborhood includes the Frida Khalo Museum and it's also close to the subway.
host_about: I like to explore places in a relaxed way when I travel. Airbnb offers a unique opportunity to experience a city from within. IÂ´ve lived in the super nice neighbourhood of Coyoacan must of my life and I enjoy sharing this wonderful place with my guests.

neiborhood_overview:
English:
The colony is divided in two: EscandÃ³n I and EscandÃ³n II, due to its great extension. The first section is located from Avenida Patriotismo and adjoins the colony Tacubaya; While Section II extends from the Pte. Miguel AlemÃ¡n Viaduct and adjoins the Colonia Condesa.

The colony still conserves great part of the constructions that correspond to the first half of century XX, emphasizing styles like: Californian colonial, and neocolonial. To the north, given the proximity to the town of Tacubaya, are located some examples of constructions that correspond to the eclectic architecture. Most of the buildings built in the middle of the 20th century correspond to apartment buildings.

host_about:
My real name is Veronica but I like to be called Veritl. ItÂ´s a name I invented in Nahuatl.
Veritl = Woman always restless with adventures in the head.
I'm 46 years old. I love to tell people how old I am because it always increases my desire to live.
I love my beautiful Mexico City and I love that anyone who visits it either for pleasure or business will have the best experience. That's why I decided to share my life experience and my Mexican house: a place to just explore who you are.
I like a lot, a lot of things: eating, laughing, exercising, reading, learning, dressing, photographing, listening, talking and shutting up, but above all, I like to walk. ItÂ´s something I enjoy excessively. I love to walk in all the different ways possible.  Walking with my eyes, is my favorite.
*****
Mi verdadero nombre es VerÃ³nica pero gusta que me digan Veritl segÃºn yo es mi nombre  en Nahuatl.
Veritl= Mujer inquieta siempre con aventuras  en la cabeza.
Tengo 46 aÃ±os pero creo que tengo 47, me encanta decir los aÃ±os que tengo ya que creo que la edad siempre aumenta mis ganas de vivir.
Amo mi hermosa  Ciudad de MÃ©xico y me encanta que todo aquel que la visite ya sea de placer o de negocios se lleve la mejor de las experiencia. Por eso decidÃ­ compartir mi experiencia de vida  y mi  casa mexicana: un lugar para volver a ser quien eres, ese que pocas veces sale a luz, pero que cuando sale te sorprende, porque aunque lo llevas dentro muy pocas veces sales de viaje con Ã©l. 
Me gustan mucho, muchas cosas:comer, reÃ­r,  hacer ejercicio, leer, aprender, vestir, fotografiar, escuchar, hablar y callar  pero  de todo lo que me gusta  para mÃ­ caminar es algo que disfruto en exceso. Amo caminar de todas las formas existentes. Caminar con los ojos, mi preferida.

neiborhood_overview:
Roma Norte is a hip, safe neighborhood. It is great for art lovers and foodies as it is filled with amazing galleries and restaurants offering all types of cuisines as well as relaxed coffee and tea shops, trendy bars, lovely parks and just about anything a well-rounded neighborhood could offer.

name: The Blue Room - Condesa - Rooftop & private bath!
description:
Cute and cosy room with private bathroom in our little house in Condesa.

The room is on the second floor of the house right next to the little rooftop full of plants and flowers!
The house is located in a private neighborhood in Condesa, that feels like a small colorful village and a haven in the heart of the city. It is safe, quiet (you'll wake up with just the sound of birds) , and ideally located to enjoy restaurants,bakeries, bars, or to go for a day of visits.

The space
This is a cute and typical mexican house perfectly located in the heart of Condesa.

The house is located in a safe & quiet private neighbourhood, and has its private little rooftop (plants, flowers and hammoc lovers welcome!)

The bright, cute & cosy room is on the 2nd floor with its window right on the terrace, with a double bed (firm) and its own bathroom, which makes it super independent from the rest of the house. There is a closet with drawers & ward
host_about:
Axelle & Olivier, 33 years old french couple living in Mexico DF
Axelle is a sculptor who works with ceramics, Oli an engineer passionate about mobility. 
We love travelling, music and cooking  :)

name: Room at my place in Condesa
description:
As airbnb gets more popular it loses its original concept: a person that opens a home to offer real life experience in the destination. My home welcomes any guests willing to become our roommates during their staying. Living with us and learning with us. Pola my labrador and me, will be happy to have you home.

My place has been better enjoyed by startups entrepreneurs and first time travelers to the city.

The space
**IMPORTANT: I only receive guests that are registered on airbnb, do not book this place if you are not the same person that is going to stay.

Your bedroom has a bunk bed (full + twin bed). Closet with a lot of space. A desk for work. Take into consideration that despite of the two beds, the accommodation is for one person only.

The main bedroom is where I sleep, but occasionally could be used by another guest when I am out of town.

Kitchen fully equipped. Washer and dryer machine can be used.

Des

El 2 de febrero se celebra a la virgencita de la Candelaria, la patrona del pueblo y las personas van a la iglesia a bendecir a sus "niÃ±os Dios" vestidos con hermosos atuendos. Las familias se deleitan con tamales y atoles para festejar; ademÃ¡s de quÃ© hay feria y fuegos artificiales con la banda del pueblo haciendo procesiones con la gente. La extraÃ±a mezcla de pueblo y ciudad le dan un carÃ¡cter muy particular e interesante al lugar. Venir a este barrio le da al visitante una mejor idea de lo que es convivir con los mexicanos de la gran Ciudad de MÃ©xico, es seguro y muy familiar.

MyPlace Leisure Homes
