host_about:
Passion for traveling, adventure, and culture. 
Through studying and working, I've had the privilege to live in several countries, learning the languages and discovering the amazing details of different cultures. 
My best traveling memories are always related to emotions I've experienced due to people. Nothing compares to the kindness and the warmth of a humble heart that wants to express affection. Not even the most luxurious palace and the most extraordinary museum can be compared to the grace of a grandma that gave me a free tour at Frankfurt after I only asked her, as a tourist, what could I visit there during the 6 hours that I had free! 
Nature lover and respectful of all that life gives us is a gift!

name: Sunny 2BR Apartment in La Condesa
description:
Welcome to Mexico City!

Our apartment is located in the heart of Condesa, one the cityâs safest and most hip neighborhoods. Itâs the perfect location to explore the different restaurants, bars, coffee shops, bookstores, designer boutiques, and lovely parks just around the corner.

The apartment is spacious and fills with natural light in the mornings and afternoons. Itâs a great and comfortable spot to relax after exploring Mexico City!

The space
Both bedrooms are comfortable and spacious. One has a double bed and itâs own bathroom, and the other has a (very comfortable) king sized bed. The apartment also has a cute little balcony where you can sit and relax. Itâs on the second floor of a small and antique building that does not have an elevator. The building was inspected following the earthquake and is in perfect conditions. Itâs such a charming place and staying here will make your experience in Mexico City unforgettable.

Gue

name: Big Room in Narvarte, close to everything you need
description:
Great place for those who enjoy staying in big spaces. The room is pretty big (17m2). The location is central and near to bars, restaurants, supermarkets, shopping malls and a park. Also the public transportation is pretty close (walkable); Metrobus is just half a block away and Subway (Metro) is 3 blokcs. The neighborhood is safe, you can walk at any time (just avoid wear fancy clothes and/or accessories). I'm pretty sure my place will be ideal for your short staying in Mexico City.

The space
My apartment was recently restyled. During the day, it is illuminated with a lot of natural light and is also big. You will notice that is kind of minimalist, because we don't like to have many furnitures but with the basic you will feel very comfortable.

Guest access
You can spend part of the day at the living room reading, drinking a coffee, having a conversation or just hanging around your social network with your cell phone.

My girlfriend and i live on the main room and the other one is exclusively for your stay also one bathroom is exclusive for you.

name: Big & lightfull Apt. in Polanco
description:
Few blocks from grocery stores, coffee shops, restaurants and bars. Located in one of the most touristic, lively and vibrant zone of the city.
Half block from Masaryk and less than 1 mile (1.5 km) from Reforma(10min), Polanquito(11min), Parque Lincoln(11 min), Bosque de Chapultepec(12min), Auditorio Nacional(13min), Museos: Nacional de AntropologÃ­a(11 min), Tamayo (13 min), Arte Moderno(14min).
Perfect spot for you to explore the city and walk around.
(walking times)

The space
Location is everything in this big city, and being just a few blocks from the most iconic spots of the city is priceless. If you like nightlife and knowing a city from its heart these will be a great spot for you. Our apartment is cozy and nicely decorated, and it is fully equipped to make your stay more than pleasant.

Guest access
Comfortable linens, great quality mattresses and some basics will be available. Great speed WiFi, fully equipped kitchen

neiborhood_overview:
Chapultepec and Polanco, though antagonistic at first sight, are intimately connected. A string of cultural sites connect Chapultepec, the great lung of the city, with the city, starting at Polanco, the most cosmopolitan neighborhood.
Sit on the stairs of the National Auditorium(13min walking) to watch all kinds of people pass by: athletes, buskers, men and women in suits, grandparents with children, intellectuals and families. They all come and they all fit in.

Chapultepec(12min walking) is the great iconic forest of Mexico City. It is the family walk on the weekends. It is the place you go to exercise. The scenery of young love. Kilometers of walking trails, lakes, the Castle, the Zoo, the Fair, parks and even a cemetery. Surrounding the park the great venues for the arts and culture: the Modern Art Museum(14 min walking), the Tamayo Museum (13min walking), the National Museum of Anthropology (11min walking), the National Auditorium (13min walking) and the Luis Barra

name: Historical House-Private Room! Near Hot Spots
description:
Lovely private room at a Historical house at Roma Norte. This unique space at CDMX will allow you to be around a safe area full of great coffee shops, restaurants, art galleries, vintage clothing stores and museums. Roma Norte has itself history, character and personality. Near to some touristic places as Reforma, Condesa, Chapultepec, Polanco or Downtown. Public transportation walking distance. You can enjoy a beautiful roof top, full equipped kitchen, living room and met more travelers.

The space
Iâve prepared my home to share with travelers from all over the world. The last years I turned my space in one that I can share and satisfy most of the needs that we have when traveling. With love and passion, I believe that every space at home has to give you something special with details. The house has history as itâs a beautiful mexican property from 1900s. I live at home and share it with travelers, as I found this a was of keeping me sharing and traveling with yo
host_about:
Iâm a digital creator & Community Leader at Airbnb
Follow my project :  @ AkevinoAlMundo 
For me, this journey of life is about people, places and questions. Sharing my places makes me happy as being an avid traveler for years gave me the vision of what we need when traveling. I feel honored helping you during your stay at Mexico, no matter if itâs for pleasure, work or any reason. Feel free to ask as much as you need before and during your stay. Iâve been hosting for 4 years with more than 5,000 travelers over the world. 
My life changed in 2015 when I traveled to South Asia for some months. There I discovered how big is our world and the millions of opportunities that life offers to us every time, every moment. That trip changed my perspective of what is the meaning of life. Why?  While traveling, I felt the need of sharing my stories with friends and family through social media, and thatâs why choose to continue this adventure of creating content. Then I stared writing for magazines and later a personal travel blog. 
Now life is about that: Travel, love, stories and sharing. 
Being an Airbnb host gave me the perspective of how places and experiences can connect people. 

Hoping to find new and great stories together.

My Travel project name: âA Kevino al mundoâ on Social Media and Web. 
IG: @AKevinoAlMundo

name: Cozy and Centric TWO Bedroom Apartment
description:
Decorated with tons of love and memories from my trips, I invite you and your friends or family to stay at my two-bedroom apartment in la NÃ¡poles, just a few meters away from the WTC and walking distance to Condesa. Ideal if you wish to stay in a centric, quiet and secure area. Make yourselves at home at this cozy space!

The space
The building was built by my grandpa in the 60s and has an eclectic style inside. Back then it was not common to install elevators, that's why the way up is only through stairs. The stairs are pretty light (in my opinion), as the apartment is located in the 4th floor. .

When you enter the apartment you'll see the living room and the dining room. To the right is the kitchen, fully equipped for you to cook! and with a small Breakfast Bar.

There are two bedrooms: One with a Queen-sized bed and the other one with two twin beds. There's only one Bathroom. Moreover, the couch at the living room can easily become a bed
host_about:
Hi! I am an internationalist and I work in an NGO in Mexico City. 

I love food, culture, arts, coffee, books, traveling, learning new languages and meeting people from other cultures and countries. 

Because of my studies, I have lived in Germany, France and Switzerland. I worked for the UN in Geneva for three months. Since then Iâve been traveling around the world, from Argentina to Nairobi. 

Right now I work with indigenous peoples in Mexico. Nice to meet you!

host_about:
I am a contented 70's year old physician who worked at UNAM - the main University in Mexico - for many years.

I am now retired, my children are grown-ups and I own a lovely house in Colonia Condesa.

I have multiple interests and activities that fill my schedule since my retirement. I work as a therapist, I study Eastern philosophies, I love to go to the movies and to concerts, to travel and to spoil my grandson.

name: Architect-designed, large Condesa home w/terrace
description:
This award-winning, large, contemporary, family townhouse is located in the heart of Condesa and counts expansive open-plan living, design furniture, abundant natural light and two large outdoor spaces.

It is a one-of-a-kind space in Mexico City, named as one of the best new buildings in the world by the Royal Institute of British Architects and the American Institute of Architects, UK Chapter in 2018.

The space
The first floor of our 4-storey family home counts an expansive open-plan living, dining, kitchen and deck area, all of which are flooded with abundant natural light through a double-height light well and fully retractable windows and doors.
The second floor counts an ensuite master bedroom as well as two children's bedrooms (one with a cot and the other with a full size individual bed) that share a bathroom.
A beautiful, ash-clad central staircase leads up to the third floor where guests have access to an ensuite queen bedroom with

name: Cozy studio with private terrace Colonia Roma
description:
Spacious and bright studio with private outdoor terrace in Colonia Roma Norte. Anti-seismic building. From your private terrace you can see, in the background, the skyscrapers of Paseo de la Reforma. It is located in Colonia Roma, the most bohemian in Mexico City, a safe and pleasant area where there are all kinds of gastronomic options, libraries, shops and bars to talk. Subway is 5 minutes walk and Paseo de la Reforma is 10 minutes walk. There is an ecobici site one block away.

The studio has a double bed and a single bed underneath. It also has a couch, a sofa and a closet for your clothes. Ideal for writers, travelers or tourists who like to stay in a cozy, central and completely renovated studio. The bathroom, kitchen and living room are in the shared area.

neiborhood_overview:
"Colonia Federa"l is one of the busiest areas near the City Airport. It is a neighborhood originally nicknamed 'the urban spider web' because its urban design resembles a spider web. It currently houses many students who attend Aviation Schools, but also Airport workers who have found their perfect location here.

The neighborhood is very quiet and is well connected to the rest of the city. Right on the corner, you will find a convenience store open 24 hours a day. In the front part there is a public parking lot that is also open 24 hours a day, with rates per hour, day or month as required.

neiborhood_overview:
STRATEGICALLY SITUATED in Roma Norte neighbourhood between Condesa and Juarez, 3 of the most cool & vibrant neighborhoods in the city.

3 BLOCKS AWAY from âReforma Av.â (the most beautiful avenue of the city) that leads directly to downtown, and which is venue of diverse cultural and artistic exhibitions.

5 MINUTES WALKING from âChapultepec Parkâ (one of the most important green areas of the city) which offers a great amount of outdoor activities.

EXCELLENT LOCATION for tourism because you can walk to the main turistic attractions: Anthropology Museum, Tamayo Museum, Modern Art Museum, Chapultepec Castle, Independence Monument, Cibeles Fountain, etc.

IDEAL LOCATION for business trips as well, due to its proximity to the main financial avenues of the city (Reforma and Insurgentes), where there are big office skyscrapers. In addition, there are 2 co-working spaces at less than a block (one right in the corner, and the other crossing the street)

neiborhood_overview:
Chapultepec and Polanco, though antagonistic at first sight, are intimately connected. A string of cultural sites connect Chapultepec, the great lung of the city, with the city, starting at Polanco, the most cosmopolitan neighborhood.
Sit on the stairs of the National Auditorium to watch all kinds of people pass by: athletes, buskers, men and women in suits, grandparents with children, intellectuals and families. They all come and they all fit in.

Chapultepec is the great iconic forest of Mexico City. It is the family walk on the weekends. It is the place you go to exercise. The scenery of young love. Kilometers of walking trails, lakes, the Castle, the Zoo, the Fair, parks and even a cemetery. Surrounding the park the great venues for the arts and culture: the Modern Art Museum, the Tamayo Museum, the National Museum of Anthropology, the National Auditorium and the Luis BarragÃ¡n house and studio are some of the must-see attractions of the city.

This spirit

name: Room w bathroom in my art studio near Reforma
description:
I am a painter with an extra room, not big but cozy, with its own bathroom at my atelier for 1-2 guests. Water supply 24/7. Near Zona Rosa, metrobus stations and Cuauhtemoc metro station. Close to downtown "Centro". Nearby there is a supermarket, convenience stores and restaurants. The area is very safe 24/7. The building has anti-earthquake system for your safety. LGBT & everybody friendly! It is 4th floor, no elevator. I have a quiet, friendly and loving dog in the property.

The space
The apartment is in the 4th floor, no elevator. The beds are individual and the decoration of the room is Mexican style. During Covid pandemic the kitchen for cooking is not available, though you can use the refrigerator and the washing/drying machine .There is a supermarket walking 2 minutes from here where you can buy groceries. Also a typical Mexican market is in a 10 minutes walking distance. Several restaurants and coffee shops are nearby including local Mexican ty

Soy alegre, optimista y a la vez maduro y responsable.  Me gusta conocer gente de mi maravilloso MÃ©xico y de otras nacionalidades.   Y tambiÃ©n ayudarlos a que su viaje sea lo mÃ¡s cÃ³modo posible, asÃ­ que si tienen dudas con gusto se las puedo resolver, especialmente si no estÃ¡n muy familiarizados con el CDMX.  Me interesan las artes y la cultura.

I am independentï½¤optimistic, and responsible and have had the experience of living in Indonesia, Shanghai China and Tokyo Japan (where I stayed at first using airbnb).   I can speak Spanish, English, Japanese and a little Chinese.  I am very interested in arts and painting.  I like to host international people so can introduce more about Mexico, its culture and interesting places.

neiborhood_overview: This is the first modern neighborhood build in the city in 1900.  It has plenty of French style buildings.  It is nearby the two most important avenues cross of the city:  Insurgentes and Reforma.  Also close in a walking distance to Zona Rosa, which is the gay area of the city.   There are plenty options to move around and two other parts of the city:  Metrobus station Reforma or Hamburgo (5 minutes walk).  Cuauhtemoc metro station (10 minutes walk).  Reforma 222 mall; it is possible to move to downtown "Centro Historico" by public transportation in less than 10 minutes.   The area is really safe because a lot of international companies and Embassies are located over here:  USA Embassy, Japanese Embassy, UK Embassy...

I'm always open to support my guests in everything I can.
I like to welcome them personally and I'm totally commited so they have the best experience here.

The apartment is on iconic Bucareli Avenue. It's one of the first avenues in Mexico City, which divides the historic center and the Juarez neighborhood. Roma Norte is two blocks away, and it's a few minutes' walk to Zocalo.

Condo is only one block to Metro and Metrobus stations. You also have other buses to move to other city areas. The best thing is that you can reach to different city atractions by walking.

Be my guest!

host_about:
MyPlace Leisure Homes

Â¡MI CASA ES TU CASA!

When you stay in one of our properties, youÂ´ll get to experience our history, culture and people with an immersive feel of our traditions all with a touch of design to immerse yourself in our culture. neiborhood_overview: Colonia Roma is one of Mexico Cityâs most famous and popular areas, not least for its hipster tendencies. La Condesaâs cosmopolitan vibe attracts the likes of artists, intellectuals and business people who bring their individual styles to the scene. This place recalls the Palermo neighborhood in Buenos Aires or SOHO in New York. One of the appeals of Condesa is simply the beauty of itâs streets. Itâs made up of lots of charming, wide avenues, with trees that form a canopy above. When youâre in one of the biggest cities in the world, these touches of nature are greatly appreciated. neiborhood_overview:
At walking distance two shopping malls: Perisur and Plaza Inbursa Cuicuilco, full of restaurants and movie theaters. Close by is the biggest stadium in Mexico: The "Estadio Azteca, el Coloso de Santa Ursula" home to two soccer football teams and popular venue for events and music concerts. Also less than two miles away is Six Flags amusement park, and several museums like Universum Sciences Museum and MUAC Contemporary Art Museum.

Across the street is one of the oldest Mesoamerican sites in the valley: Cuicuilco, a cradle of the Mexico Valley civilizations and the forerunner of the Teotihuacan civilization. Close by there are several major parks and ecological reserves.

Ten minutes away is Tlalpan center (Tlalpan centro), this center, despite being in the urbanized zone, still retains much of its provincial atmosphere with colonial era mansions and cobblestone streets.

A lot of places to eat, from small street vendors to upscale restaurants. Ask me if

neiborhood_overview:
At walking distance two shopping malls: Perisur and Plaza Inbursa Cuicuilco, full of restaurants and movie theaters. Close by is the biggest stadium in Mexico: The "Estadio Azteca, el Coloso de Santa Ursula" home to two soccer football teams and popular venue for events and music concerts. Also less than two miles away is Six Flags amusement park, and several museums like Universum Sciences Museum and MUAC Contemporary Art Museum.

Across the street is one of the oldest Mesoamerican sites in the valley: Cuicuilco, a cradle of the Mexico Valley civilizations and the forerunner of the Teotihuacan civilization. Close by there are several major parks and ecological reserves.

Ten minutes away is Tlalpan center (Tlalpan centro), this center, despite being in the urbanized zone, still retains much of its provincial atmosphere with colonial era mansions and cobblestone streets.

A lot of places to eat, from small street vendors to upscale restaurants. Ask me if

name: LUXURY TERRACE APARTMENT IN THE HEART OF CONDESA
description:
This stunning two story townhouse apartment is right on Av. Amsterdam in the heart of Condesa, one of the hippest, liveliest neighborhoods in Mexico City! Designed by arquitect Derek Dellekamp this beautiful apartment is decorated with all original art and design. Three bedrooms (1 queen, 2 twin beds) 2 full bathrooms, 1 half. Living room, reading room, fully equipped open kitchen with dining room and living room that open up to a huge terrace overlooking Av. Amsterdam. A true gem in the city!

The space
The original faÃ§ade of the building is from 1930's and still remains, the building was designed by renown architect Derek Dellekamp, he created a contemporary space within the historic one. The townhouse apartment has two stories, the rooms are located on the first floor and on the second is the open kitchen dining room and living room area with sliding glass doors that open up to a huge terrace overlooking Av. Amsterdam. So whether you want to sit on the terrace
host_about: My name is Ernesto, Iâm from Ciudad de Mexico. I own various restaurants around the city, including La Capital, one of the best Mexican food places in the area and El Malafama, a billiard hall and restaurant. I also am the proud owner of the best jazz club in Mexico City and Latin America El Zinco Jazz Club, so that will make it very easy for you to get reservations. ; ) I am also a painter and have my studio in Condesa. I have seen this neighborhood change and transform into what it is now. I love food, traveling and art. I have lived in various countries in America and in Europe and speak Spanish and English. It will be a pleasure to meet you and welcome you into my home.

name: Cozy modern apartment in 16th century CoyoacÃ¡n

It is a modern apartment in 16th century CoyoacÃ¡n filled with natural light. The apartment is perfectly located just ten minutes away from JardÃ­n Centenario (the main plaza in CoyoacÃ¡n) in Santa Catarina.

The space
The apartment has a beautiful private terrace with a table and chairs where you can have a meal or read a book.

Other things to note
The apartment is on the third floor and to get there you need to take a tight spiral staircase.

Also, CoyoacÃ¡n is a sixteenth century colonial neighborhood. Mexico City has a water problem. In general, in CoyoacÃ¡n we donât have water problems. Please be mindful of the water you use during your stay. Hot water lasts for 10 minutes which is more than enough for a good shower.

*IF YOU ARE BRINGING A PET PLEASE LET ME KNOW BEFORE YOUR ARRIVAL. WE HAVE AN EXTRA FEE FOR PETS.
host_about:
I am an art historian from Mexico City. I am completely fluent in English and Spanish and I also speak French quite well. I know the city pretty well and can recommend anything from bars, restaurants, museums to cool places to visit. 

I recently published a book about the history of CoyoacÃ¡n through fragments. The book is available in El PÃ©ndulo, El SÃ³tano, and Gandhi or directly with me. It is a must for any lover of the neighborhood.

Close to both Metro Sevilla and Sonora Metrobus stop.

neiborhood_overview:
La Condesa is one of the 'trendiest' areas in Mexico City and also one of the safest. It's full of great wee places to explore on foot including a wealth of bars, restaurants, cafes, galleries and shops.
Parque MÃ©xico and EspaÃ±a are great for wandering around or exercising - both have free open air gym facilities and jogging tracks - and are the perfect option if you have kids as they both have excellent play parks and are just 100 meters from the apartment.
If you fancy a bit more of an adventure the massive Chapultepec park is just 1km away, it's brilliant for running, walking, cycling or visiting the museums and huge free zoo inside it.
Roma neighbourhood is also just a stone's throw away which is another great neighbourhood, that's where you'll find Mercado Medellin, our favourite market for all things food related.

neiborhood_overview:
STRATEGICALLY SITUATED between Roma, Condesa and Juarez, 3 of the most cool & vibrant neighborhoods in the city.

3 BLOCKS AWAY from âReforma Av.â (the most beautiful avenue of the city) that leads directly to downtown, and which is venue of diverse cultural and artistic exhibitions.

5 MINUTES WALKING from âChapultepec Parkâ (one of the most important green areas of the city) which offers a great amount of outdoor activities.

EXCELLENT LOCATION for tourism because you can walk to the main turistic attractions: Anthropology Museum, Tamayo Museum, Modern Art Museum, Chapultepec Castle, Independence Monument, Cibeles Fountain, etc.

IDEAL LOCATION for business trips as well, due to its proximity to the main financial avenues of the city (Reforma and Insurgentes), where there are big office skyscrapers. In addition, there are 2 co-working spaces at less than a block (one right in the corner, and the other crossing the street).

Guest access

description:
Â¡Hola! I have an available room in my completely furnished two-bedroom apartment in Roma, walkable to the beating heart of the trendiest neighborhoods of Mexico City. This beautiful, cozy and one of a kind home is located in a traditional architecture building. A comfy and sunlit bedroom with Smart TV is at your disposal. The apt offers HIGH-SPEED WIFI 200 MBPS, perfect for foreigners looking to live like a local while working remotely.
Flexible for check in/out!

Apartment to share with me :)

The space
The apartment is ideally located, in the heart of La Roma neighborhood, but away from the busy and noisy areas. Next to the trendy Cine TonalÃ¡, and just a few blocks from Condesa.

With every public transportation (metro, metrobus, ecobici and bus).

Guest access

host_about:
My name is Karen, I'm a Mexican, graphic designer, who works at Marcom.

Traveling and exploring new places are my passions. Life for me must be vibrant and full of joy and excitement. I adore getting lost in new places, discovering new flavors, learning about new cultures, and surrounding myself with fun and interesting people.

I love my country, the people who live in it, its culture and diversity. One of my favorite interests is to help people discover Mexico and enjoy it as much as I do; others include practicing sports (yoga mainly), pretending I'm a photographer, petting every dog I cross by, learning new languages and cooking (I'm a pescetarian).

Lovely private room at an Historic House at Mexico City. This unique space is at la Roma Norte, the favorite area to explore our magic city. Location allows you to walk to all the touristic places as Reforma, Condesa, Chapultepec or Historic Center. With many parks and a lively street life, Roma is the perfect stay in a safe and beautiful environment. Great CafÃ©s, Restaurants, Museums and art places near by. The space
Youâll stay at this beautiful historical house of mexican colony of 1900. It has a lot of history and if youâre into architecture you can realize the much effort weâve put to make it more special to share with you. Every area or room at my house has been prepared carefully with love but thinking in style. Details are important and I hope you see this here.
My idea was to create a place to connect with travelers, but creating environments is important to help t
host_about:
Iâm a digital creator & Community Leader at Airbnb
Follow my project :  @ AkevinoAlMundo 
For me, this journey of life is about people, places and questions. Sharing my places makes me happy as being an avid traveler for years gave me the vision of what we need when traveling. I feel honored helping you during your stay at Mexico, no matter if itâs for pleasure, work or any reason. Feel free to ask as much as you need before and during your stay. Iâve been hosting for 4 years with more than 5,000 travelers over the world. 
My life changed in 2015 when I traveled to South Asia for some months. There I discovered how big is our world and the millions of opportunities that life offers to us every time, every moment. That trip changed my perspective of what is the meaning of life. Why?  While traveling, I felt the need of sharing my stories with friends and family through social media, and thatâs why choose to continue this adventure of creating content. Then I stared writing for magazines and later a personal travel blog. 
Now life is about that: Travel, love, stories and sharing. 
Being an Airbnb host gave me the perspective of how places and experiences can connect people. 

Hoping to find new and great stories together.

My Travel project name: âA Kevino al mundoâ on Social Media and Web. 
IG: @AKevinoAlMundo 
Feel free to follow the adventures.

VIVO PARA VIAJAR Y VIAJO PARA VIVIR :)
Yo digo que si el destino quiere que viaje, pues yo obedezco y viajo :)

Mi pasiÃ³n es viajar y he tenido la oportunidad de explorar el mundo por diferentes medios, por aviÃ³n, por crucero, por tren, metro y casi cada medio de transporte.
Disfruto mucho conocer gente de otras nacionalidades y aprender de cada uno, por eso entre a Airbnb y cada dÃ­a estoy mÃ¡s agradecida de haberlo decidido, ya que la plataforma me ha dado muchas oportunidades y contactos, asÃ­ que ven a casa, acÃ¡ te recibimos con los brazos abiertos!

I have a degree in Tourism, my passion is to travel and life has given me the opportunity to go around the world getting to know many countries and cultures.
I have worked for the tourism industry for over ten years, even aboard Disney Cruise Line, Celebrity Cruises and Princess Cruises.
I love Mexico City because it has everything for a magnificent stay.
My favorite places are the Chapultepec Forest and Castle, the Anthropology Museum, the Centro HIstorico (central downtown and the Palace of Fine Arts.
On the outskirts is the ruins of the City of Teotihuacan and the magic town of Xochimilco.
I enjoy sharing with positive and enterprising people.

Cozy & very centric apartment. Two bedrooms (king-size and double bed) with a fully equipped kitchen and high-speed internet. We are very strict with the sanitization of the entire place before arrival and we provide weekly cleaning. We also offer self check-in, for the safety of our guests.

The space

Double shower is the perfect setting for your partner and you enjoy a relaxing night,

Even though it is on a main street of Medellin, its an inner building with nice the just amount of daily sunlight and an evening quite spot

I am fan of falafel, i actually have a falafel place in Mexico City, falafelito. 

I love to backpack, and camper travelling, i owe a VW camper bus - my sweet westy.

Roma is a wonderful neighborhood - you are practically in the heart of the happening, everything is in a walking distance or via the near public transport get to explore all the important places of the city.

host_about: Hi! I am an architect and a constant traveler. Every time I use Airbnb, I hope to find a super clean, safe and cool place. I hope the place coincides or exceeds the expectations generated by the listing  and have a simple and direct communication to access the apartment without problems. I love when  I find   useful suggestions of good places to eat or what places in the city I should not miss. I hate when I do not have good internet because it is indispensable for my work or to be able to watch a movie at night. I appreciate when the place where I stay offers some basic things like sugar, salt and oil, because I can cook without having to buy things that are going to be wasted later. As a host I try to provide at least the same experience that I would like to receive. Nothing less.

The atmosphere is spacious (1550 sqft apt + 650 sqft wrap-around terrace); bright Mexican color with touches of both industrial (slate kitchen bar, oversized steel color sofa) and Mexican tradition (Runners, pillows, from Chiapas; tiles).

You're our GUEST in the place we used to live in for five years, the place we love and still visit. It's furnished with our things that we love; the opposite of impersonal.

5th (top) floor,
host_about:
I love world travel, languages, photographing architecture and color, and tech.
I'm from Los Angeles, but lived 11 years in the Netherlands, 6 years in Mexico City, and am now back in the U.S. in Washington, D.C.

Motto: Keep Exploring. Keep Listening and Learning.

Favorite destinations: Mexico City, Amsterdam, St. Petersburg (before), Berlin, London, Barcelona, San Diego/Tijuana, New York, pueblos mÃ¡gicos in Mexico

Books: Crime and Punishment, Hundred Years of Solitude, Singularity is Near, Chariots of the Gods, A New Earth, Why Buddhism is True

Movies: Room with a View,  Mommy Dearest, El Norte, Bond films, films with SNL alumni, BuÃ±uel films, The Color Purple

TV: Sopranos, Ozark, Berlin Babylon, Black Mirror, AbFab, Little Britain,  Family Guy, I Love Lucy, SNL and (secretly) Sex and the City.

Show: haven't seen it yet, but Hamilton. Avenue Q. 

Music: commercial pop (even Maluma), progressive trance, Chopin, Ella, Frank, samba,  Mecano, Alla and Sofia, Arabic.

Food: chicken tinga, mole, tacos al pastor, chicken Tikka masala, Penang curry, avocado, red velvet cake, salted caramel in any form.

Obsessions: Maps. As big as possible. History of Europe. Ancient civilizations.

neiborhood_overview:
Roma Norte is the hippest neighborhood in the city full of chef-driven restaurants (like Maximo Bistro), bistros, cafÃ©s, independent shops, and galleries, many housed in French-style mansions from the turn of the 20th century. Intermixed you will still find âa real Mexico City neighborhoodâ with MedellÃ­n market, tortillerÃ­as, corner shops, and retirees reading in the park. Leafy Art Deco Condesa is a few blocks to the west. The historic downtown, Anthropology Museum, and Polanco are each two miles away - a short hop by Uber or try rental bikes, Subway, bus, trolleybus or just walking and exploring!

Roma Norte and surroundings are very, very safe - chock full of pedestrians, doormen, and police. My only âwarningâ would be as in any big city, avoid walking down dark empty streets alone after midnight. Only for walking downtown and other crowded areas (so NOT in Roma) and public transportation I advise: Keep valuables hidden and inaccessible, purses and backpacks close, and do

Look forward to meeting you :)

neiborhood_overview:
LA CONDESA

The trendy neighborhood in the city and one of the coolest in the world, according to Vogue Magazine. Are you looking for a good place to eat? Going partying? Or maybe you're in the mood for a bit of cultural leisure? If so, Condesa is where you should be.

Walk a little through its two main parks - Parque EspaÃ±a and Parque MÃ©xico - where you will find some of the best restaurants, bars and concert halls. You can also explore Amsterdam Avenue and discover several art galleries, bookstores, shops and cafes.

With a marked European style in its architecture and its attractive lifestyle, the Countess has always been the meeting point for artists, intellectuals and celebrities. Full of beautiful people and with style, the only thing that is missing is you.

name: The perfect room in downtown Tlalpan
description:
The perfect room in Downtown Tlalpan. Walking distance to the hospital area. We clean the room and bathroom daily. Daily breakfast included: Fresh cut fruit, yogurt, cereal, milk and coffee.
Big closet and the room is in a beautiful house.

Working area inside the room. Near the quaint area of Downtown Tlalpan. Great restaurants and interesting sites to see.

Extra food and laundry can be settle with the owner.

The space
This area of the city is very quaint and safe. The house is a beautiful one and not crowded. The habitants work all day and are here at weekends.

Guest access
You will be able to use the kitchen, breakfast area, laundry, the down terrace and living room. It is a big house.

Other things to note
You will feel at home.
host_about:
A sensuous life!.
Travelling one of many passions.
My house is a temple,  love to share it with guests and treat them as they deserve. The energy one feels stepping inside the house is one of "nice to be home"
Guess I expect to feel the same, when I travel.  

As a guest I will respect every corner of the house I get in, as I shall expect the guests that stay at my house do the same -when staying at my place-.

Love to:
Eat, enchanting places, art, 
to read and a movie freak.

My favorite destinations are the cities that have tons to tell. Europe and Eastern Europe are my favorite destinations. Asia, blows my mind. When I travel to Asia, I would probably stay in one of the best venues. History is part of my life so as long as the destination has historical links, it will probably fit in this category. To be in contact with nature, but mostly the beach.

name: Cozy guest room in HipÃ³dromo Condesa quiet area
description:
This is a beautiful designer's home situated amongst tree-lined streets in the upscale neighborhood of Condesa.
We are a couple of guys and a dog living in an apartment with eclectic style decor. Our place is located nearby the best coffee shops and restaurants of the area/city and you even can hear bird chirping outside the window in the mornings. We speak fluent spanish, french and english. People from all over the world is welcome in our place.

The space
The room is spacey, queen bedroom and desk. The apartment has large rooms, service room and kitchen. The building has an elevator, a 24/7 doorman, nearby coffee shops and restaurants. Quiet and easy to get transportation.

Guest access
Access to both bathrooms, kitchen, service room with laundry, living room and dining room.

Other things to note
Our dog Canija is a senior, mellow small english bull terrier. She likes to gossip and sleep.

name: Classic 1930's Condesa house with beautiful patio
description:
Classic two-floor Condesa house from the 1930's, in one of the most iconic streets in the neighborhood, away from the bustle yet close to restaurants / bars and a stone's throw from the famous Condesa parks.
The house is spacious and bright, with a lovely functional kitchen (w/breakfast table) and a cool living room, both connecting with a beautiful patio yard surrounded by plants, ideal for disconnecting. There's an elegant dining room, two confortable bedrooms and two full art decÃ³ bathrooms.

The space
We love living in this house, and only rent it when we're away on vacation. Thus, we try to make it as enjoyable as possible.
To quote some of our past guests, "an absolute gem of a home!, the architecture is breathtaking and the decor is perfect", "it was even more than expected", "the apartment was big and had everything we needed, the patio in the backyard was fantastic for breakfast and to just relax in the afternoon", "great location".
host_about: We're a multicultural couple based in Mexico City who love nature. We really enjoy travelling, visiting new places to meet people, other cultures, and experience new food.

neiborhood_overview:
Insurgentes sur is one of the most important avenues in Mexico City. From there you can get to almost any place by public transportation or by car. Insurgentes sur is known for having a lot of different options for entertainment, shopping and tourism. 5 min walking from the building you can find shopping center "Manacar" which is one of the newest shopping centers in the city and where you can find options of entertainment such as stores, cinema and bowling.
In front of the building you can find "Galerias insurgentes" which has great options to eat and shop. For example, this mall has a store called "Liverpool" where you can find almost everything.
10 minutes walking from the building you can find a Walmart.
The neighborhood is very safe, it has cameras in almost every block.

name: Beautiful 3BR 2BTH Apt. in Col. Roma Norte
description:
Beautiful 3 bedroom apartment located in the center of Colonia Roma.

THE APARTMENT IS SANITIZED TO PERFECTION AFTER EVERY STAY.
WE HAVE ALL SAFETY AND HYGIENE MEASURES.

The apartment has 3 bedrooms, two bathrooms, kitchen, and a living room with TV.

Located in a silent street surrounded by restaurants, cafes, and bars. One block away from the beautiful plaza Rio de Janeiro.

Very close to a subway station, Metrobus station, and many major streets like Reforma and Insurgentes.

The space
-Master Bedroom with one queen-sized bed, sofa, and a working desk. It has its own bathroom, shower, and a big closet.

-A second big room with one queen-sized bed, it has its own closet and shares a bathroom with a shower.

-Smaller bedroom with two individual beds, that shares a bathroom and shower.

The apartment additionally has:
-Kitchen with everything you need
-TV
-Wifi
-F

name: Nice apartment with kitchen
description:
Small apartment for three with one bedroom, kitchen and a bathroom. All the comfort, with complete privacy and facilities. In low level, near subway station, less than 5 km from downtown, 8 km from airport and 4.3 km from Foro Sol. Recently remodeled, everything new. Near you can find markets, shops, bakeries and a park with game's zone for children and excercise tools. The neighborhood is really quiet and surrounded by main avenues with a variety of restaurants and coffee shops.

The space
Comfortable apartment near historical center, on the ground floor and with a small garden. It is located in a quiet and safe neighborhood and a few km from the airport. Here you can find markets, coffee shops, bakeries and a park for children in the same street.

Guest access
It has a kitchen with all services, microwave, fridge, blender, etc. There is also a small garden at the front of the house, and one bathroom. Everything is new, recently remodeled.

name: Casa Kamffer 3, the studio full apartment
description:
We welcome you to this unique colonial type of house, in front of one of the most beautiful squares in the city, you can walk through the old french style neighborhood, full of cafes and some of the best restaurants in town, we are near most of the museums, cinemas and night life. in fact you will be in one of the trendiest parts of town.
We live right besides so we will assist you in any way we can, come and enjoy this cozy and secure apartment.

The space
The house was built in the 1930ies and is divided in various apartments, you will be surrounded by plants and birds even in the middle of this big city.
Stay in a house with history it was a gallery, a school, the the location of three films and a documental about ecological urban development.

Guest access
You have your own kitchen, a bathroom, a bedroom and a extra room to use as a studio a living or a dinning room as you needed

Other things to note
W
host_about: I am an artist, I use a computer for my work  I call it digital painting, support Liverpool FC, like traveling, going to the sea, looking at nature, worried about climate change, i like listening to music  old english rock bands or classical music,  I also enjoy being alone quietly, i use a bicycle to get around sometimes going as far as 50 km in a day, I go crazy in  rock and roll concerts, love  the theatre,  the cinema  and of course I like having a good conversation in a nice coffee shop.

name: Trendy, Light-Filled Flat in Artsy Neighborhood
description:
Explore Mexico City's eclectic streets with this impeccably-designed apartment as your base. The light-filled flat features Aztec-inspired accents and mid century furnishings, giving the property a straight-out-of-a-magazine feel.

Our modern home is situated on an upper floor of a brand-new modern apartment building right in the middle of the trendy Roma and Condesa neighborhoods.

Master bedroom: Queen-sized bed, Floor-to-ceiling windows, an in-room bathroom/shower with a built-in bluetooth shower speaker, large closet, 49" 4K HDTV Roku TV with Netflix and Cable, balcony overlooking the city.

2nd bedroom: Queen-sized bed, large closet, adjacent bathroom/shower.

Kitchen: Brand new 6-burner stove and oven, Ninja blender, toaster, microwave, complete dishware/cookware, full knife set, Mr. Coffee coffee maker, water heater, mixing bowls, large fridge/freezer, water filter, coffee, tea, spices, bar seating.

Living/Dining Room: 6-person
host_about:
Hey! I'm Sagiv. After traveling the world for a while, I moved to Mexico City in December 2017 and fell in love with the city. I'm an investment analyst by day, and In my free time I like boxing and diving. 

You can also find me checking out museums, going on hikes, and attending concerts and shows around the city. Happy to give recommendations!

I speak English, Hebrew, and a bit of Spanish.

Cheers!

description:
This full apartment is all you need for a short or long stay. Full kitchen, nice bathroom, confort bed, and a sofa for an extra guest. We have elevator and security 24 hours.

Beautiful Roof top, kitchen, sofa, living room, fridge, elevator.

My house is just next to the apartment so IÂ´m fully available to help you.
IÂ´ll be helping you before, while and after your stay. Once you reserve I can share my website where you can see all the content of my travel project that also includes suggestions for travelers at Mexico City. For me, Airbnb is not just a business, is about sharing my country and our culture.

Roma Norte is a safe area of the city full of art galleries, restaurants, coffee shops, independent artists, musicians, parks, public bicycles, public transportation, and great places to walk. With a very hipster vibe and dynamic rage of gastronomic offer, plus the buildings from the Porfiriato, you can enjoy its amazing walks.

Uber, ta
host_about:
Iâm a digital creator & Community Leader at Airbnb
Follow my project :  @ AkevinoAlMundo 
For me, this journey of life is about people, places and questions. Sharing my places makes me happy as being an avid traveler for years gave me the vision of what we need when traveling. I feel honored helping you during your stay at Mexico, no matter if itâs for pleasure, work or any reason. Feel free to ask as much as you need before and during your stay. Iâve been hosting for 4 years with more than 5,000 travelers over the world. 
My life changed in 2015 when I traveled to South Asia for some months. There I discovered how big is our world and the millions of opportunities that life offers to us every time, every moment. That trip changed my perspective of what is the meaning of life. Why?  While traveling, I felt the need of sharing my stories with friends and family through social media, and thatâs why choose to continue this adventure of creating content. Then I stared writing for magazines and later a personal travel blog. 
Now life is about that: Travel, love, stories and sharing. 
Being an Airbnb host gave me the perspective of how places and experiences can connect people. 

Hoping to find new and great stories together.

My Travel project name: âA Kevino al mundoâ on Social Media and Web. 
IG: @AKevinoAlMundo 
Feel free to follow the adventures.

name: Bright bedroom w view to private patio in Condesa
description:
It's a luminous 140 sq mtr/ 1507sq ft two bedroom apartment with a private patio. Outside the living room/ diner/ kitchen is the common patio thus the apartment is well lit from all sides. Considering the fact one of the busiest avenue is just downstairs (Avenue Insurgentes), it is surprising how quiet and calm the apartment is.
I love plants so there are many in all corners plus fresh flowers from the market. Wish you enjoy my dream house as much as I do!

The space
Welcome to spend time in the spacious living room + diner, the kitchen and the restroom. I love spending time at home arranging things and taking care of plants. Or simply having some coffee or tea and read a book.

Guest access
You can get to the building terrace by the stairs outside the kitchen, where you can hang clothes and have a view of the area!
The patio only has one entrance through my room so is not accessible.

A Chinese living in Mexico.

I have been lived in China, MÃ©xico and the United States and have been trying much to see the world.

neiborhood_overview:
*I am on the "la Condesa" side of Avenue Insurgentes but "la Roma" is just across the street. :)
La Condesa is one of the trendiest neighborhoods in Mexico City. There is a super nice park and some best cafes/restaurants/bars/clubs in the city.
I love this neighborhood especially because of all the greeness around. Parque Mexico is always a great place to take a walk to and strolling or running along la Avenida Amesterdam is quite enjoyable. The 24 hours fresh juice stand, flower corner shop together with Friday flea market, are contributing no less than all the restaurants and coffee shops, adding charms to this unique colony.
